Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Trimus
Reviews.Content: From the dealings with the staff before we arrived so our friends that were sharing the apartment could book in before us) to the courteous goodbyes on our departure our stay at the Medina Grand was a delight. The location is great with many of the attractions of Sydney within walking distance (to be honest Sydney's central area is so compact that getting around on foot is easy). If you want to go further afield the metro is just round the corner. Some great places to treat yourself to coffee for breakfast near by (My Sweet Memory was our choice but the QVB is not far away which gives you even more choice) and a large Woolworth and a well stocked bottle shop to get supplies for supper. The two bedroom (one en-suite) apartment was large and spotlessly clean (and kept so by the helpful and cheerful cleaning staff) with everything we needed (although it took us until the last evening to find the chopping board). We had a room on the 25 floor which gave views towards the Chinese Garden of Friendship and was very quiet. There was plenty of space to relax, write cards and play games. Would definitely recommend the Medina Grand to other travellers and will be checking if they have an apartment when we next travel to Australia.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Tauranga, Bay of Plenty, New Zealand
Reviews.Title: “fab accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Debbie M
Reviews.Content: Awesome service - great location to darling harbour, city and markets - clean room, frinedly cleaners - cpuldnt have asked for beeter accommodatikn

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Medina Grand was very comfortable and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Theresa M
Reviews.Content: After a long trip from America, I was very impressed with the accommodations at the Medina Grand. First and foremost was the kind courteous attention I received from Lisa Thomson. Check-in was a breeze. The view of the Sydney was amazing. I was able to relax comfortably in the spacious and very clean living area with a flat screen tv and comfortable couch with throw pillows and the kitchen area was nicely equipped. The cleanliness of the bathrooms and bedrooms was excellent. My bed was very comfortable and the linens were always nice and fresh. The Medina Helped to make my visit to Australia an unforgettable experience. Staff was always ready to meet my every need with a smile. If I am ever lucky enough to come to Australia again, I will definitely stay here. It goes without saying that I would recommend the Medina to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rooms, Even Better Staff”
Reviews.Author: Steve M
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bedroom apartment with absolutely stunning views. Extremely comfortable with all the touches and conveniences of home including a full kitchen,nice bathrooms, laundry, etc. The reception and service staff were exceptional and informative offering suggestions of places to visit, good deals on tours, and even showing how to get around on a map they provided. I always felt welcome as I was acknowledged every time I walked past the desk. Check-in and check-out were painless and smooth. The Medina Grand is central to most things in Sydney and is just across the street from the train station. The rooms were nice and clean the entire stay. Thanks to the heated pool, spa, and indoor gym, there was always something to do, even on a rainy day. With great quality in both customer service and room quality, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable, Clean”
Reviews.Author: lightwork
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were given a complimentary room upgrade to a spacious two bedroom apartment - how's that for fab customer service?! Within walking distance of supermarkets, transport hubs, many major sights and restaurants, the Medina was a good choice for our week in Sydney. Access to not only a kitchen but also a laundry within the apartment was very welcome. Be aware that you are in the CBD of a major city, and even though the rooms are well sound insulated, there may be some noise if you are a light sleeper, so use earplugs if that is the case. We enjoyed our spacious, comfortable apartment with a view in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Great city centre hotel with apartment facilities & space”
Reviews.Author: Phicus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mercure Grand Sydney for 7 nights in December on business with my better half. We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment on a higher floor with a balcony. Check-in was smooth & the staff were pleasant & helpful. I have to say they were great during the entire stay & acknowledged us each and every time we walked past the reception desk. The room was very spacious & the furniture fairly simple but with an added Barcelona chair (for design geeks). The Televison was a plasma & had plently of the local cable channels, there was also a mini Stereo player althogh this was not a dvd player it did also act as an ipod dock. It may be better to have a weay of connecting PC's or Ipods/Ipads to the TV screen in possible. The bathroom was large with a shower over the bath there was also a Washer & Dryer which we made plenty of use out of during our stay The Bed was very comfortable & there were plently of pillow options. Overall the bedroom was comfortable & had a second wall mounted plasma TV although I was woken at 4am on one of the first mornings as a previous guest seemed to have set the 'wake' function on the television. I wish hotels would have housekeeping check any device in the room with an alarm after each check-out to make sure said device does not go off in the middle of the night for the next guests! The Kitchen I have to say was a little bit old but all the appliances worked, the utensils were a little old as well though & some a little worn out. I had all the utensils I needed to cook with though. There is an oven, Microwave, toaster, kettle, stove, full size fridge & a dishwaser which housekeeping kindly ran for me each day although on a couple of occasions I could've waited until it was a little more full to save some water but, nevermind I appreciated the touch none-the-less. The stove is a glass top electrical style which is not the greatest for gourmet cooking but, being a hotel I understand this from a safety standpoint. Sadly I did not use the gym during my stay & the Pool which is outdoors but covered seemed to be emptied for rennovation. I used the internet which seems expensive at $25 per day however I could connect 2x devices at a time which was good for my laptop & ipad. Once connected the speed was good. Overall I would stay again & recommend the hotel to anyone who wants a more comfortable space & to feel like you're in your own apartment rather than a run of the mill hotel. It's centrally located & has great staff. There are some great dining options just outside the door to with Chinatown not so far away.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: G V
Reviews.Content: Stayed here early Feb.'12. Day time desk staff barely took the time to make eye contact, but night staff was very attentive. Internet access and laundry were outrageously priced. I found the room uncomfortable for the first two nights as the air con was not blowing cool. Tried adjusting the thermostat in the room (the "down" button was crushed and faded from countless hundreds of other guests trying in vain to lower the temperature). The staff informed me that it was inherent to the hotel's air handling system (read: sorry, it can't be helped) and they sent a fan up to my room. While not a complete solution, I appreciated the effort. The following day an actual technician came by while I was out and fixed the air con. This was great, but left me wondering why it had to be fixed on the 3rd day of a 4 night stay. Are they so accustomed to getting complaints about the A/C that they routinely disregard them as 'the same old complaint that we can't do anything about'? Told the same desk staff on day 1 that the elliptical machine in the "gym" was squeaking and needed a bit of oil on the bearing. This is a $1 fix. This was not attended to. The rest of the fitness equipment was antiquated and seized up due to a sloppy spray paint job that bled onto the moving surfaces of the machines. My travel department booked some of my co-workers and I at the Medina Grand, and some at the nearby Park Royal. Having seen the digs at the Park Royal, I would book there if you're traveling to the CBD of Sydney. On the plus side: Once the room was cool, it was comfortable. The location is also great. The kitchenette was a nice feature that enabled me to hit Woolworths and stock up on basics, which saved money on food. Not a big deal if you are expensing food, but if traveling on your own dime it's a good approach.

Reviews.Title: “Basic business accomodation”
Reviews.Author: myvoyager
Reviews.Content: Basic apartment type accomodation. Ok gym and slightly outdated overall. Average value.

Reviews.Title: “Handy”
Reviews.Author: Geeitsabigworld
Reviews.Content: Hotel was close to Chinatown, Darling Harbour, Town Hall station, World Square and also the City. We stayed in a two bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment with a kitchen and laundry as well. Big rooms, quiet and everything anyone could possibly need. The only thing missing was a container to make ice blocks in the fridge. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, well equipped rooms. Service mixed.”
Reviews.Author: Mark G
Reviews.Content: This is an apartment style hotel therefore the rooms are fitted with either basic kitchen equipment (kettle, toaster, microwave) or more sophisticated which includes hob and washing machine. All useful if you are staying in the city for a longer period and want some home comforts. Â  The location of the hotel is excellent. Just outside of Town Hall station for easy rail transfers from the airport. A 5 min walk from Darling Harbour and 20-30 (depending on pace) walk from Circular Quay. It is 5-10 mina walk to the main shopping area.Â  The rooms are a good size and an excellent standard.Â  Hotel check in was awful. The receptionist was very abrupt and unhelpful. However this appears limited to one or two members of staff. The others are friendly and helpful.Â  The hotel has a small gym and internet access. The wifi is expensive at $12.50 an hour, which to be honest is a rip off.Â  Overall 4 out of 5. Marked down for check in and expensive wifi.Â

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Apartment, great position.”
Reviews.Author: jonclo
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a fabulous position. Very luxurious. Walk diagonally across the street to the Town Hall arcade and train station. Large clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: tdbt1016
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews found here on tripadvisor for our stay in Sydney in Feb & we were glad we did. The hotel is very conveniently located. You can cross the street & walk through an underground shopping area to get to the Town Hall train station, all of 5 minutes. China Town, Darling Harbour are all within walking distances. Shops & restaurants are all around the hotel. The hotel itself is ok, a bit dated - swimming pool & gym is small, but adequate. Room is decently sized & equipped with a flat screen & mini kitchenette. Staff is nice, from front desk to housekeeping. Ask for room on a higher floor so you can get nice view of the city. Internet is extra, but there's free wi-fi from a cafe by the front desk area, so we were down in the lobby at night to check our email. Overall, a pleasant stay experience & I would recommend others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: D-tip
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. We had a huge, clean room with a great view of the city. Balconies and onsite parking are two big plusses but the location is also excellent for exploring Sydney. We were there as a couple but it would be a great property for families as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: SJ S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night passing through town and couldn't be more happier with the hotel. I wish I had stayed longer. My biggest thank to Andy the receptionist who went above and beyond to help us with all our silly questions. If you want a great place to stay with beautiful rooms, amazing staff and in the heart of the the city stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Abby1005
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel because we were given an upgrade upon arrival and had a whole 2 bedroomed apartment which gave lots of space and a superb view from a panoramic window and also a balcony. We stayed there after 3 weeks of travel and so it was very handy to have a washing machine and dryer. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Medina Grand on Kent Street”
Reviews.Author: PJB1696
Reviews.Content: Not as good as Medina Grand apartments further along in Darling Harbour. However, rooms were clean and service good. Location close to most sites if prepared to walk a little. Balcony had very minute view of Harbour but mostly of cities and streets which was quite noisy. Shower over deep bath is very dangerous with nothing to hang on to. Kichenette small with no hot plate (although advertised) just a microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with good-sized apartments”
Reviews.Author: ozbev
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Medina for 3 nights in a 2 bedroom apartment. It was certainly roomy enough for 4 adults. Decent sized kitchen with everything required if you wanted to self-cater. Both bedrooms had a queen-sized bed, one bedroom had a balcony, which also went off the substantially sized loungeroom. There is a bathroom and an ensuite, both of a decent size. If any criticism, the ensuite shower could have been made larger, but was sufficient for us. Good sized towels and if you want them changed daily make sure you put the "make up room" sign outside your door. The location being close to CBD and also Darling Harbour/Cockle Bay was very good. Staff very friendly and helpful. It was very quiet, and unless you had the balcony door open, you couldn't hear traffic noise on the 25th floor. Booked through Booking.com and the rate was very reasonable. I would definitely recommend this property for stays of up to a week or more.

Reviews.Title: “First Impressions...”
Reviews.Author: southerntravelbase
Reviews.Content: I was so looking forward to staying at this property but have experienced such poor customer service so far that I am astounded. The website was down the evening that I was trying to gain information and book a room, so I immediately jotted an email off to the Medina asking for information on packages and room rates. So far it's taken two days, eight emails and a tolll call to gain the simplest of information from the Medina Grand's Reservations Coordinator. As it stands I have now received an invoice that has higher rates on it than quoted. Arghhh!! I just hope that this employee is the exception to the rule and I look forward to being able to update my review with something positive.

Reviews.Title: “fab, fab fab.”
Reviews.Author: Marie010
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Location excellent, apartment fantastic. We were upgraded from a one bed standard to a superior one bed apartment on the top floor. Fantastic views of Darling Harbour. So well equipped. Spotless. Really comfortable. Didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: KellyZ
Reviews.Content: Yup, the location is awesome. The harbor is 2-3 blocks down the road, Chinatown and the markets are also nearby. Lots of pubs, shops, restaurants in this area as well. I liked everything about this place. The rooms were exactly like the hotel photos- clean and updated. No problems with noise, there's a nice little pool, never made it there, but we could see it from our balcony. We stayed in a suite which is basically an apartment. If this is the location you want to be in and the Medina is within your budget I would look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: nick m
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on the weekend, it was a work trip with 4 guys. we had a two bedroom apartment with 4 single beds. the room was spacious enough and clean. The noises in the early hours of Saturday were a little noisy at times but nothing bad enough to ruin your sleep. Fantastic location and very reasonable price. we found the staff to be very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: Robyn D
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently in a 2 bedroom apartment. The bedrooms were very spacious, both with king sized beds. The kitchen was well equipped, however the dining chairs and lounge chairs were very worn. The apartment was clean and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: WERNER S
Reviews.Content: We were with 3 children from Noumea during two weeks for the first time; the apartment was very quiet; service was very clean. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The building has got a very central situation in the CBD close to famous TOWNHALL train station, George Street shops, restaurants and night entertainments, close to Darling Harbour and also close to Chinatown. Very safe place for family with children and also good night rate. Werner STERGIOS NOUMEA NEW CALEDONIA

Reviews.Title: “Small and basic”
Reviews.Author: Asterix2903
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel is well located the room has the bare minimum. It's clean but the control for AC on the wall is for show the AC is controlled is centralised. The $100 bond on check in is taken immediately but I was told it could take up to 10 days to be recredited. Staff are not helpful and not interested or appear so. Suggest you look around you can find better than this tired hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Conference Facilities - you can find better”
Reviews.Author: TravelCrazyPenguin
Reviews.Content: I recently spent some time at the Medina Grand in the conference room, the room was set up to our requirements and the facilities where ok. However the staff, the food and the lack of flexibility really discounted the location and pricing of these conference facilities. I would most certainly book your conference elsewhere if you want happy staff who want flexibility in their booking.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: Preefab
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised by the average rating of this property having visited in early December 2011. I have to say I booked this property based upon the good reviews on tripadvisor and convinced myself that the few poor reviews were exceptions. We booked a 2 bedroon, 2 bathroom apartment here for 5 people for 5 days (including a 3 year old). Here are the + and - of our stay: First the +'s: 1. It really is a great central location near to Darling Harbour and Shopping area 2. The bedrooms are reasonably sized and there is a good sized living room. 3. The apartment had good washer and dryer facilities (but no soap provided so take your own). The porter was helpful. Now the -'s: 1. After a long flight to Sydney, we had to wait 4 hours before we got a room. When we finally got a room, Reception told us that there was a smell in the room and placed a humidifier in it. We were told to turn the humidifier off when we were in the room and turn it on when we left! Having turned it off, the smell was unpleasant so we asked to change rooms. We got a room directly 2 floors above. Why give out a room when 1. you know there is a smell in it and 2. you have another available 2 floors above? 2. I have never seen as much mould in hotel bathrooms as there was in this apartment. We were on a trip of the Far East and Australia and this was 1 of 8, four star properties we stayed at. The shower in the ensuite bathroom was covered in it. There was less in the other bathroom but much more than I would have liked to see. The back of the fridge had a layer of mould on it too. I complained about this the next day. Reception said they would send someone to deep clean the next day. I have no idea if they did or not, but I noticed no difference. The next day I was asked whether it had been cleaned and I told them that, the only way they could get rid of that mould was to re-grout the bathrooms. He made a note. 3. The room had views of the walls and if you stuck your head out enough you could see some buildings towards Darling Harbour. 4. The kitchen is not equiped to cook for a family of 5. The 1 egg sized camping frying pan and butchers knives were comical. We asked for bigger pots and got one. 5. Unfortunatley Sydney was cold and rainy during our stay. The hotel's air conditioning system was set to cold so it was not possible to turn the heat on. We were given one portable fan heater to heat up the apartment! Having read some of the poorer reviews and the hotel manager's responses, I informed the hotel of our problems whilst we were on site to see if they could rectify the situations. I won't be recommending this to friends looking for a 4 star level of accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Skyeeeee
Reviews.Content: This was the first time me and my partner had been to Sydney. We stayed at the Medina Grand Sydney for 3 nights. We arrived at midday from Adelaide, reception advised the room was not ready, that was fine, we just went across the road to the pub and had a meal. Came back at 2pm and the room was ready - to our surprise they had upgraded us to a One Bedroom Premier Apartment!!!! The view we had was amazing, especially at night as it overlooked Darling Harbour! The bathroom was cleaned everyday, the shower had ok pressure, the kitchen was huge (we didnt cook in it though) The bed was comfy enough. The lifts were the only problem we had, there are only 2 and they do take there time. Reception was friendly. The pool was small but lovely after a hard days shopping! Would definatly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: jonnyred
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week over the New Year period, and of course the hotel was very busy. There are only 2 lifts which can mean long waits at busy times, which is frustrating. The hotel itself is good, but is starting to look dated and needs updating. We stayed in a studio on the 18th floor. Compared to other apart-hotels we've stayed in, the room was quite small, and the kitchenette didn't have a hob - just a microwave. We had a balcony though, and the room was kept clean and tidy by housekeeping. The gym and pool area are ok, but quite small. The location is very good - close to Darling Harbour and a short walk from most attractions in the CBD. My biggest gripe with the hotel is regarding wifi. You get free wifi downstairs in the lobby, but only until 10pm. The charges for wifi in your room are astronomical - totally unacceptable! There is no laundry room but I believe the larger rooms have washing machines. Ours didn't unfortunately. Not sure I would rush to stay at the Medina Grand again, unless I could be upgraded to one of the deluxe rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Poor sleep, nice rooms though!”
Reviews.Author: Jack S
Reviews.Content: While visiting Medina Grand for an overnight stay, me and my co-worker got a free upgrade to an executive suite. The suite had a magnificent view to say the least, a 180 degree view to the city skyline and the circular quay. The living room was equipped with a fully featured kitchen and the lounge had a surround sound system with leather seating. Only problem I found with the executive suite was that the sliding curtains couldn't fully close, the curtain sliders gets stuck in the middle leaving a gap in the window. Sydney had a lot of night lights and it bothered me a lot. Checking with my co-worker in the morning, his curtains wouldn't close at all. Service was forgetful. I had a friend visiting me and I had arranged for receiption to pass a spare key to my friend. However when my friend arrived at reception an hour later, they had forgotten about this and I had to come all the way down. Other than that, everything else was flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Duncastle
Reviews.Content: Our best holiday of 2011 was spent in Sydney at the Medina Grand in the CBD. It is so central and near to all tourist attractions. The apartment that we have was on the top floor, very clean and all that we needed was there. The staff was very good and helful at all times would recom

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, spaceous rooms”
Reviews.Author: paddleballdude
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located with a 15 minute walk to the harbour. We had a suite with a kitchenette which came in very handy for breakfast and for late afternoon snacks after a long day of sight seeing. There is a Woolworth only 5 minutes away so stocking up the fridge with food was convenient. Dining out in Sydney is very expensive so a kitchenette was well worth it. We were on the 19th floor and the view was stunning. The finess room was small but it had the necessities - treadmill, eliptical, stationary bike, free weights and a universal gym machine. the front desk staff were very helpful in recommending restaurants in the area. Ramona was especially helpful and friendly in this regard. hopefully, she is there if you visit and need recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Sooz068
Reviews.Content: Medina Grand was very central and nearly bigger than my own apartment in Perth. Staff were very friendly and always willing to help. I booked a one bedroom apartment so I could cook my own meals. It was very clean and I love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Oli_Bee
Reviews.Content: Staff were accommodating & very nice.. All requests were met. Location was in walking distance to lots of attractions. Stayed in two bedroom apartment with all amenities.. A big Thank you Andy for being very very helpful during my stay. Room 89.

Reviews.Title: “Medina Grand Hotel Apartment Accom.”
Reviews.Author: Thommos17
Reviews.Content: This is a great centrally located hotel within walking distance of Darling Harbour(5 mins) and Circular Queay (approx 20 mins). I stayed here with my 4 children and I would definitely stay here again. The price was reasonable and the apartment had a kitchen and 2 bathrooms. Staff were all very welcoming and helpful, especially Andy who is a very friendly front desk worker. I would recommend this hotel when travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Good well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: mirroden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Medina, Kent St for 4 nights in Dec 2011. This is a well located apartment hotel just one street from George St. From the hotel, just walk up Bathurst St till you reach George St (KFC on this corner) and then you are very close to the Town Hall, QVB Building, Woolworths and Galeries Victoria. Market St where you can find Myer and David Jones and the Pitt St Mall is just a short walk and going the other way down George St you can find World Square and further down is Chinatown and Paddys Market. If you go down the hill at Bathurst you can cross a bridge and get easy access to Darling Harbour. Town Hall Railway Station is close by (go through the undergound arcade where Kathmandu store is). The hotel has a small lobby, 2 lifts, and a small cafe on the corner (free wi fi in the cafe). We stayed on the 10th floor in a spacious 2 bedroom apartment facing east (2 bathrooms and laundry, well equipped kitchen). Small balcony and not much of a view but I think the rooms on the west side would have views of Darling Harbour especially if you are above the 20th floor. Free newspapers delivered to your room in the morning. Lots of dining options nearby. Tetsuya's is on the same street but only for the well heeled traveller. If you like Ramen - try Menya at the north end of kent St or Aisen Ramen. From the airport you can catch the SkyTrain for about AUD16 takes about 30 mins but you have to lug your own luggage through the train station (get off at Town Hall Station) or we caught a taxi about AUD50. I am sure there are flasher hotels but this is central, close to shops and restaurants and transport options. There is also a small indoor pool in the hotel which we did not use.

Reviews.Title: “Near everything”
Reviews.Author: soap-on-a-rope11
Reviews.Content: Reception was very helpful- stayed 5 nights and all questions were answered courteously. Close to trains - we walked 1 block after getting train at airport to downtown. Train to Bondi Beach was 20 minutes. We walked each day to Darling Harbour (7minutes) what a beautiful spot. From there we ferried to the Opera House and The Rocks. Room was more than adequate- especially with the kitchen and laundry facilities. Would like to see WiFi added to the room. Paid $60.00 for three days- I pay less than that for a month at home. Pool area and weight room are well-kept. Would stay here again; no worries.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gidget67
Reviews.Content: Just spent 7 nights with my 3 children aged 15, 10 and 9 and my 18 yr old niece in a 2 bedroom premier apartment #126 on the 27th floor. Originally we booked a standard 2 bedroom apartment but was given one on level 10 with a poor view. The reception staff worked hard to find another one and was able to give us another one on the same floor with a slightly better view. So we asked for an upgrade to a premier room and was given an upgrade for 50% off the normal price to the 27th floor ... SUPERB views of Sydney and the Darling Harbour. GREAT location. Diagonally across is the Town Hall train station. A short 5 min walk is the monorail, light rail and bus stops. 20 min walk to Powerhouse Museum (we saw Harry Potter exhibition), Capitol Theatre (Mary Poppins) and The Domain. 10 min walk to Darling Harbour and the ferries. We snuck out of the Carols early, made it back to the hotel (via train) in 20 mins and in time to see the Carol fireworks from our apartment window. We bought a metro pass (all transport methods) for a week - cost $40 adult and $19 for all children. This was the best, easiest and fastest way to get around and we even got the train from the airport to Town Hall station and walked across to the Medina. Apartment was great. 2 bedrooms with comfortable beds and we got a roll away which was placed in the lounge area. 2 bathrooms which came in handy with 3 girls and a kitchen with microwave, stove, fridge, dishwasher and all the cooking and eating utensils. Laundry was through the 2nd bathroom. Room service was daily - they only replaced 4 towels (not one for the 5th guest) but the kids swam in the pool daily where there were fresh towels - so they would bring up extras. Didn't use internet as we had a prepaid mobile internet USB but we had great coverage. Staff were great - reception met our request with the upgrade and printed off tickets and boarding passes. Asif was a terrific attendant - giving us advice, telling us to call him at housekeeping should we ever need anything and bringing up things to the apartment. He saw us on the way out struggling with 3 suitcase and helped us out. He always greeted us and made us feel known and welcome. The gentleman who booked us in (wish I got his name) always greeted us also and he remembered what we were doing on which days and would ask us how it went - very friendly! We ordered groceries from Woolworths online. Woolies delivered them to reception and Asif bought them up to the apartment. Woolworths is a short 5 min walk past the Town Hall. We ate breakfast there daily and sometimes lunch and dinner. Housekeeping would clean up and turn the dishwasher on daily. Coffee, Tea and sugar were replaced daily but milk is only complimentary on the first day. Close to many restaurants - within walking distance. 20 min walk from David Jones where we saw the Christmas windows and 10 min walk to Hyde Park and Paddy's Market. Darling Harbour playground with water activities is also a great place to visit with the kids. Only complaint - which is nothing the hotel can do anything about - was the noise of the sirens (often through the night) and the bells of the Cathedral which rang for HOURS on Sat and Sun mornings :( After awhile we got used to the bells while we were awake - slightly painful at 9am when you're trying to sleep in. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and would love to stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best location but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: MelDou
Reviews.Content: We love the location, but only basic facility offered in a premier one bedroom unit. The service and attitude of reception was sooooo terrible. It should be warm and friendly, instead, it was very cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: trainfan2000
Reviews.Content: This is an apartment hotel that is located in the heart of downtown. We stayed there twice on our recent trip to Sydney, once before our cruise and again after the cruise. We had a one bedroom apartment the first time and a standard room the second time. The one bedroom apartment was well appointed with washer, dryer, stove and a large fridge. The standard room just had a microwave and bar fridge. In both cases the beds were comfortable and the rooms clean and well appointed. We had a minor housekeeping problem in one room but it was fixed within minutes of calling the desk. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown. The Town Hall Station complex of interconnecting buildings can quickly be accessed by walking across the street. Once there, the Queen Victoria Building and other shopping areas can easily be reached. The Darling Harbour park area is a five minute walk from the hotel. If you are taking a cruise ship, the docks are about a $12 cab ride away (10 minutes). There are lots of good restaurants in the area. If you want to prepare your own food in the room, there is a grocery store five minutes away. A reasonably priced internet connection with printer and computer is located off the lobby. In summary, a very good hotel located in the heart of the Sydney CBD, convenient to stores and public transportation. We will stay there again when we next go back to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Right there”
Reviews.Author: pete p
Reviews.Content: If you want a handy reasonably priced hotel in Sydney then this is the place, great location 3 minutes walk to the town hall and queen Vic building, 10 mins easy walk to darling harbour. Rooms were clean and tidy, bed was comfy, iron and ironing board, fridge with expensive mini bar, and a microwave. Bed was comfortable, had a balcony with opening doors on the 28 th floor, great view, staff were very friendly and helpful. There is no room service or free wifi but the cafe in the lobby has good reasonable food and free wifi. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Surly staff”
Reviews.Author: Itwhizz
Reviews.Content: Avoid staying here at weekends as it is a favorite with the younger party set. We had about 3 rooms of teenagers and they partied all night. Staff very very surly and pleasant to deal with at all. The only up side was the cost - I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: shound1030
Reviews.Content: Upgrading some rooms while i was there. Rooms are smallish but efficient Lifts are slow small restaurant onsite Located on chinatown border so lots of bars and restaurants to choose from 5 mins to Qvb shopping etc

Reviews.Title: “1 bedroom apartment for parents”
Reviews.Author: kevinleng
Reviews.Content: I booked the 1 bedroom apartment for 8 nights for my parents when they came to visit me. Had a no fuss check-in although we had a late check-in at around 7pm. The apartment itself was very spacious and nicely decorated. Kitchen looked a bit dated but very much adequate as to their needs. Room was also nice and bed was comfortable (I tried it out). Was a great plus that they had Foxtel channels. Location wise it was excellent. Just a stone throw away from Town Hall train station and a short walk to Darling Harbour. Expected it to be a little noisy as it was on the corner of Kent and Bathurst Street but it was actually fine. The negatives of the apartment was that the air-conditioning wasn't exactly cold and was a little stuffy. Sometimes after a long day around the city, we'd head back and you could barely feel the air-conditioning even after it was left on for a long time. However, opening the windows did help a lot as it was spring time. While not needed at all times, it would have been a nice to have to just cool down. Secondly, I was a little disappointed that we had to pay for clothes washing powder and softener. I stayed in a service apartment myself when I first came to Sydney and I was provided with sufficient detergents, washing powder, softener and etc to last me the full 14 days I was booked in for. While I do not expect Medina Grand to provide an entire 1L bottle of detergent or softener, it would have been a nice touch to provide a complimentary pack (sufficient for 1 full wash) as we were booked in for 8 nights. I believe that's a fair amount to provide and if anyone needs more than 1 wash per week then they'll have to pay. Overall, I have to say that the experience was good. The service was good, apartment was very good and location was excellent. Pricing wise, I'd say it's a little on the high side but what would I expect from such a centrally located hotel with decent facilities and great rooms. Worth every penny and will recommend it to friends/family who come by Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “great central location”
Reviews.Author: BDTBdixon
Reviews.Content: two bedroom apartment was roomy , clean & had full kitchen facilities & lcd tv in parents room was handy. It was literally 1.5 blocks to supermarket, train station, public buses. 2 min walk to darling harbour. Only disappointments were Pool was not huge but big enough for kids to play, and some lamp fittings in our room were bent. could just see anzac bridge from our balcony but no harbour views. would go back there again & recommend to friends

Reviews.Title: “A splendid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara V
Reviews.Content: My Kiwi friend and I were at the end of a 6 week trip touring Queensland and New South Wales. We stayed at a total of 12 hotels, mostly apartment hotels, and were lucky that we did not have one bad experience. However, 3 of the hotels at which we stayed stood out as being particularly good and this was one of them. The staff at reception were particularly friendly and helpful from when we checked in early to when I personally checked out late. We were due to fly home on October 30th, my friend to Auckland, me to London, but on the afternoon of 29th we turned on the t.v. to discover that Qantas had grounded its entire fleet! My friend was flying Air New Zealand and was thus OK - I was in trouble!! The evening receptionist, Ramona, could not have been more helpful, looking up the Qantas website for me as I was not travelling with a computer and enabling me to get a communication from my travel agent in England (who had fortunately managed to book me a new flight on another airline just 24 hours late) via the hotels e-mail. They were also able to book me in for a further night and as the sun was shining in Sydney I made the best of my extra time. The apartment itself was spacious, light and comfortable and had lovely views. There was some late night noise from revellers but our insistence on sleeping with the windows open would not have helped this! We enjoyed the pool and generally felt at home. The location of the hotel was ideal, being only a short walk from Darling Harbour from where it was possible to go just about everywhere by ferry. Good shops were also within walking distance. Generally a lovely end to a super holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: flowless_81
Reviews.Content: We have recently visited some friends in Cairns and stayed there in the apartment style accommodation. We decided to go with apartment style accommodation for Sydney too. Weâ€™ve done some research online and Medina Grand Sydney appeared to be exactly what we needed. We booked a 2 bedroom apartment. On arrival we were greeted by young receptionist. She was very informative, friendly and nothing seemed to be too much trouble. We arrived in the morning and our room wasnâ€™t ready, but we could leave our luggage, reception advised us of places of interest in the City while we were waiting for the room, they gave us maps and promised to call us once our apartment was ready. Reception called around 2 hours later and, as we were only in Darling Harbour (5 minutes walk from the hotel BTW), we decided to go back to the hotel. We were greeted again, this time by another staff that issued us with keys, and we checked in. And what a room it was!! Reception informed us of an upgrade to a higher placed 2 bedroom. But we did not expect this. It was a very big apartment with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, full kitchen, balcony and small laundry. We had the most amazing view from the balcony. Our luggage was already in the room too. Additionally, there were fire works in Darling Harbour in the evening and we could see it all from our balcony. Our kids loved it!! Kids also enjoyed the pool very much. We are very much recommending this hotel to others and should we return to Sydney we know where to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement but overall okay experience for a serviced apartment type property”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLuv
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed in a serviced apartment in Sydney before, but because of the amount of time I was spending this trip I decided to give this place a go. The location firstly is pretty good. Certainly not the ritzier part of the CBD/city area but it is not too bad. There are 2 supermarkets within 5 minutes walk and a multitude of little restaurants in the surrounding streets. There is no exterior driveway to the property which makes it difficult for drop off and pick up with luggage. Staff were friendly enough, not much to comment on there. I chose a premier one bedroom unit on a higher floor. The lifts in this property are extremely slow and noisy. The apartment itself is okay, very spacious with a fully fitted kitchen, large bathroom, small laundry room. Bathroom needs a bit of spruicing up, it is tired with moldy black grout. The bedroom and living areas are functional but not luxurious. The bed is my biggest complaint. It is just plain uncomfortable. The bed is the quality of a very cheap bargain basement spring bed. No padding and all you feel is the springs underneath you. The location can be a bit noisy because you are right in the CBD. Gym is surprisingly not bad for this kind of property, it is not fantastic BUT I have seen much worse gyms in 5 star hotels. I'd stay here again if I was doing another extended trip in Sydney. The appeal of a fully functional kitchen is great for long stays. The couple of things holding me back are the beds and the tired bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Most Terrifying & Horrible Experience"”
Reviews.Author: tbuff86
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to start to explain the torment we went through during our stay. To sum it up we spent 90% of our holiday fighting for our safety and to be heard from the incompetent staff and managers. We even had to result to getting the Police involved as the hotel staff didnt want to hear, noR offer help in the fact that our hotel room got BROKEN INTO not once but THREE times. Not to mention having to hear from other guest that they saw this happened and that our room was left wide open all day! Also on the second break in we saw there BellHop standing outside our door stading still staring inside our room! Managers also treated us like crap, (except the assistant manager was friendly n tried but was consantly undercut by the act manager) and we found him (the manager) and also the area manager to be extremely defensive and abusive and unwilling to take the situation seriously and didn't offer any compensation until we complained long and hard and had to get our lawyer and police involved before they took us seriously, even then it wasn't enough (specially after pay over $1000 for 2 nights)! Also received abusive, defensive comment when explaining the situation to the manager such as "we will never give you compensation" "how dare you, our staff has been her for 8 years and we have lawyers and you can prove anything it's our word verse yours" ect. The whole first night was spent staying awake out of fears that someone would break into our room again and to wait till the manager in the morning as the night weekend staff member was unqualified to do anything and was completely rude and insulting! The whole experience was disgusting and I'd advise anyone thinking to stay here to seriously consider staying somewhere else. I've lived in Kings Cross for most of my adult life and I have never felt unsafe until I stayed at the Medina Grand Sydney. Oh I forgot to mention that te security was terrible, no cameras on floor to catch the culprit who broke into our room and no security staff on, only the dodgy guy down stairs who let a drunk man sleep on the reception couch, until I told the cops to kick him out, and by the looks of it he did no security check. A BIG breach in their DUTY OF CARE! Unfortunately for us it was the long weekend and we were stuck in this Hotel of Horrors! Wouldn't wish this experience on my worst enemy! Still recovering from this tortuous experience!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Earwe
Reviews.Content: Great location close to city centre, Darling Harbour and transport with Town Hall Station arcade being directly opposite Clean and tidy accommodation, with helpful and courteous staff. Parking available but we elected to use public transport Must mention the pub across the road. First class Bistro on first floor but unfortunately not open every night. Very good food at a very reasonable price. You will find it hard to beat the Medina. Our suggestion, don't even try.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_kiwi_sydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a two-bedroom premier room over a Friday and Saturday night with my partner and 2 friends. I won the hotel stay as well as hair & make-up stying and cocktails in the room. The room was everything we needed. Plenty of space for the 4 of us. There was a full separate laundry which was a nice addition. The beds were very comfortable. There is a full kitchen with everything you need to make meals in the room, as well as a good size fridge - I love that it wasn't a bar fridge! The most impressive thing was we actually had a snake (which we found out later was not very dangerous) crawl out of my friends car. The receptionist on duty was amazing - she said she had worked with reptiles before. She got the snake into a bag and it was collected by the wildlife people. I would definitely staff here again if I ever needed this type of accommodation and will recommend to anyone travelling to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kristin C
Reviews.Content: My husband, three children and I spent four incredible nights at the Medina Grand Sydney. Our two bedroom unit was on the 29th floor (top floor) and the views were amazing, Darling Harbour and Sydney Tower from my bedroom window. The location were perfect for my family as it was a short walk to both Darling Harbour and the City Centre. The Town Hall train station was a two minute walk and the monorail was about five minutes. There is a cafe on the ground floor that has reasonably priced meals that my three "fussy" children enjoyed. The rooms were serviced daily and the beds were very comfortable. The kids also enjoyed the heated pool and sauna. We will definitely visit Medina Grand next time we are in Sydney. Thank you for wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: Mloleary
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff . . . I don't want to leave! I got a great weekday rate at this centrally-located business hotel and have really enjoyed my stay. I'm in a studio with dishes, plates and a microwave, which is perfect for being away from home for a while. It's very centrally located with Darling Harbour, Chinatown and plenty of shopping all just a few blocks away. I also appreciate that the gym equipment is new and well-maintained. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheGlassHouse
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights in the Medina Grand Hotel in Kent Street Sydney in a standard studio apartment. We had planned the holiday for 6 months as we bought very cheap Virgin air fares when they were on sale and because we looked at the same time found a good deal on the price of the accomodation. Even if you look on the internet it can sometimes pay to ring the hotel and ask what their best prices are as they will sometimes better the internet price. Anyway we accepted their deal but had to book and pay for the hotel then and there. There were no refunds or changes allowed but we are talking a difference of hundreds of dollars so if you are game (and if you take out travel insurance) you can get yourself a good deal too. We had stayed at a Medina in Melbourne last year so were familiar with the size of their rooms and their amenities. As I have a bad back I look for hotels that have a heated pool so I can exercise every morning. This hotel had the pool and it was ok except that although covered overhead one side of the pool area is exposed to the outside air making it freezing when getting out of the pool. The area and pool were always clean and well maintained and there were plenty of towels. There is also a gym for guests use. Our room was on the 26th floor and faced a wall but we had a small balcony that we could see a bit of Darling Harbour on one side and some of the lights of Sydney on the other. There was a lot of traffic noise when the door to the balcony was open but having fresh air was great. When the door was shut there was no noise. The room was not huge but big enough for 2 and had a toaster, microwave, sink, small fridge, crockery, cutlery and some food preparation dishes and utensils. It had everything most rooms normally have, tv, clock radio etc plus a table and 2 chairs and plenty of wardrobe space, a safe and an ironing board and iron. The room was clean and serviced daily as was the bathroom. The shower (over the bath) was great with good water pressure. What they didn't have that the Medina in Melbourne had was a small communal laundry for guests to use. In Melbourne there was one for the studio guests to use as the other rooms had washing facilities in them. It was only the size of wardrobe but had a washer, dryer and sink in it. I missed having this and it meant I had to take more clothes with us. This hotel does have a laundry service but like all hotels it was expensive. The only things that I would suggest to improve this hotel is for the bed to be a little firmer and higher. It was very low, I hit my arm several times on the bedside table while sleeping as the bed was level with the bedside table. With the bed so soft and with soft sides it wasn't very stable to sit on the edge and as it was so low not always easy to get in and out of (for someone with a bad back). The other thing that would be good would be to have a comfortable chair to sit in. I have yet to find any hotel with a comfy chair in your room where you can sit in a read a book and lets face it we can't be out sight seeing and shopping every minute of the day. The location of the hotel was great. Next time we will get the train into the city (you get off at Town Hall station) from the airport because it is literally a five minute walk to the hotel through the Town Hall Square shopping centre and is all under cover. When you walk out of the shopping centre the hotel is just across the road. In this shopping centre there is a Woolies supermarket, a Subway, as well as a variety of food shops, a chemist and newsagent as well as lots of other shops.This shopping centre leads to The Queen Victoria Building, The Galleries shopping centre, even the Westfield shopping centre and the mono rail. If you are like my husband there are 2 Starbucks within 5 minutes of the hotel as well as Krispy Kreme donuts, McDonalds, Hungary Jacks and hundres of eateries giving you a ton of choice. We found the Albion Hotel value for money with a lovely rump steak dinner for $9.90 with a drink purchase and if you don't mind a bit of noise the Edinburgh Castle Hotel do a good schnitzel even at 9pm at night. Paddy's market and Market City are only 10 minutes walk away, Darling Harbour is about the same and Circular Quay is about 20minutes walk away. We bought ourselves a weekly 'Multi 1' ticket for $41 each and this took us every where we wanted to go. Circular Quay and the Rocks (the markets are huge on Saturday and Sunday) is only 2 stops away on the train and to go to the Paddington markets on a Saturday take the train to Museum (4 stops away) and catch a bus just outside the station and go down Oxford Street. Catch the ferry to Manly for breakfast on a Sunday and visit the Manly markets (many of the same stalls from the Paddington markets) or take the ferry to Watson's Bay and have fish and chips sitting under a Morton Bay Fig tree. We took a ride on the ferry up to Parramatta and back just for the ride. All this for the price of our tickets, that is better value than the $20 one day ticket and a lot cheaper than going on a cruise around the harbour. Sydney is a great place for a holiday and my husband can highly recommed the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. The Medina is certainly a place we would go back to especially if we can get a great deal like we had this time. If we had to pay full price I am not sure I would.

Reviews.Title: “Generally fine”
Reviews.Author: Daren L
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 2 nights in a Studio room. The room was clean and tidy and a good size. There was a small kitchenette with fridge, sink, microwave and kettle with tea and coffee. The bathroom included a bath tub and combined shower. The hotel facilities were quite good with a gym, sauna and covered pool area. The location of the hotel was good being not too far from Darling Harbour and the QVB. It was also close to a heap of restaurants, pubs, clubs and Chinatown. The only downside was that there was no room service after 9:30pm but this wasn't a big issue. The staff were friendly and efficient. Subject to price I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment living”
Reviews.Author: Bryan-Lisa
Reviews.Content: This was one of the better priced and located hotels that we could find in Sydney. We were very happy with our stay there were 4 of us in the apartment which was spacious quiet and clean. Reception staff were great and Andy you were very helpful. Thank you. If there are room for improvements is that we were not replenished dailey for shampoos and soaps and tea and coffee. We had to ask. I also do not like Credit card surcharges as a surprise. I was advised that this is normal for Sydney but I am a regular visitor and have not had this before. If we had paid on line there was no surcharge so a tip for others out there. It is not the cost of the surcharge but the principal as a traveller you do not carry cash for accomodation expenses!! This does not stop me from staying there again as we really enjoyed the stay. Overall the hotel is close to Darling Harbour, shopping and the train.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it should be - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: FiverACT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a short (3 day) business trip and found the hotel to be everything I expected and needed, maybe even more. The room was clean and generously sized, with a large bathroom that had a full-sized bath and shower over bath, the most amazing thing about the shower over bath was that you could take a proper shower and manage to keep the bathroom floor dry! I travel quite a bit with work, and normally find that shower over bath set-ups end up leavign water all over the bathroom floor, so this was a welcome change, and a great functional design. Back into the main room and there is a small kitchenette in the corner, a table and chairs, as well as a small workdesk - everything I needed during my stay. There is also a large wardrobe with mirrored sliding doors - no hunting around for tiny hotel mirrors, these mirror doors are great! The TV sit on the side of the workdesk, and is easilly viewed form bed, or from the table and chairs, it's a reasonable sized flat screen as you'd expect and has all of the free to air channels including HD. The only downside was the pay TV channels, I'd been told by my booking agent (admittedly not the hotel) that there was a number of pay TV channels, I assumed the standar package with Lifestyle, Discovery, Sports and a Music channel, but instead I found the only pay TV channels were all sports channels with the exception of Arena. A little disappointing but didn't really make a big difference, and like I said, it was the booking agent who failed to properly manage my expectations here, not the hotel. Finally, I must mention the staff. They were exactly the way I like them, friendly and professional without being pretentious. Everythign was smooth and trouble free with everyone I spoke to, and I was treated like a person rather than a number or an unapproachable exec. I really appreciate that sort of service and rarely find it - If people from the Medina are reading this, keep doing whatever you're doing to find, train and keep your great staff - they turned a good place to stay into a great place to visit. I'll certainly recommend this property and no doubt will return next time I have business in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and would go again”
Reviews.Author: robeik
Reviews.Content: A choice made after reading Trip Advisor's reviews. Clean, friendly and efficient staff, no problem checking in and out. Great location for walking to Chinatown and Darling Harbour. Good access to the underground train and Woolworths if you need some food (breakfast, snacks) too. The view from our small but adequate room was a sliver of Darling Harbour. Not sure what the view from other rooms would be. There was a balcony but from memory there was not even room on it for chair.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: iejrugbyleague
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews about this hotel we took the plunge and booked a 5 night stay as part of our trip to Australia. The staff from the outset were excellent - friendly and very helpful. The accommodation was superb. We were on a higher floor and had really good views of Darling Harbour. While not cheap it was good value for money considering the prices in Sydney. It has a really good location close to all the main attractions. We would certainly use this hotel again when we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Frade
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a 1br and a studio, but due to all of the flight cancellations around that time due to the volcano plume disruptions, they upgraded us to a 2br deluxe studio. Much better! The room was fantastic. Heaps of space, great amenities. Staff were pleasant. Nice views of Town Hall and Centrepoint Tower. Location is ideal. A few steps from Town Hall Station, and a quick walk to Darling Harbour or to Pitt St Mall.

Reviews.Title: “great location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: faerian
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2 nights and found the central location and the friendly helpful staff just awesome! very comfy beds and they were great about holding our bags before the room was ready!

Reviews.Title: “great for short trip”
Reviews.Author: ozpix
Reviews.Content: Satyed 1 night in June 2011. Had a 1 bedroom apt on the 29th floor with balcony which had a fantastic view of the city skyline. The room was nice & modern & comfortable & service good too. The hotel is located close to transport & Darling Harbour only 5 min walk away. The only negative was that the pool water felt very cold, we thought it would have been heated a bit more. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: shamtaku
Reviews.Content: with a family of 2 young children we found the hotel to be perfect for all our needs. our 2 bedroom apartment was so spacious and very clean. kitchen is well equipped and was great to have a laundry too. we stayed for 5nights, all the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. our room was serviced daily to 5star standard! they have a great swimming pool and the gym is also good though we didnt use it. the location is perfect, everything is within walking distance,the aquarium,sydney tower,great shopping etc... we will definately be staying here again on our next trip to sydney and have recomended it to our family and friends. the hotel is across the road from town hall train station so easy to get train to and from the airport. woolworths is only a short walk away,very handy for us to get a few things for the kids breakfast,snacks etc... if you want first class accomadation in a great location this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the apartment”
Reviews.Author: kirstiepurdie
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay at Medina Grand in a 1 bedroom apartment. For the style of accommodation we think it was excellent. The bed was exceptionally comfortable and all the facilities were well maintained. Housekeeping was efficient and my request for blankets rather than a duvet was met with efficiency. As we have an accommodation business ourselves we have a critical eye and were impressed with the service we received. Comments about noise from other guests surprise me as we were on the traffic light corner on Level 10 and it did't bother us at all! Only thing we would comment on is the airconditioning.. pity there aren't split systems as the central systems never seem to cater for everyone's needs but that is life!

Reviews.Title: “View, Location and excellent service"”
Reviews.Author: LeviAdsJess
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom apartment with a balcony overlooking the breathtaking Darling Harbour. Absolutely couldn't fault this hotel, Impressive in every way and extremely excellent value for money. Well Done Medina and thankyou for making our memory of Sydney an unforgettable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Aspiring1
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel because it was very close to the train station. I was pleasantly surprised to find that we had a very nice one bedroom apartment even though it was only for one night. The apartment was tastefully decorated and the TV reception excellent. The hotel is within walking distance of just about everything and if you don't want to walk, you can take the trolley or train or bus. Our room looked down on the train station, but it was quiet. Highly recommended especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: PabMac
Reviews.Content: We booked the medina as a short stay self cateering aprtment so were very disappointed that the 'kitchenette' was next to non existent. Even what we thought was the fridge was actually the minibar. Your kitchen is in a tight corner with a sink kettle, toaster and microwave. Really these rooms should not be sold as having cooking facilities. even making a sandwich in the tight space was difficult. Other than this however, the rooms and bathrooms are a decent size and maintained daily. There is a good gym, sauna and pool. The location is very good and the price we paid wasn't too bad. All in all the Medina was more like a hotel with limited services than short stay apartments. The weekend noise could be a problem for some as there are many bars around.

Reviews.Title: “A great alternative to the downtown Sydney "Conference Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: KODB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Medina Grand while attending a medical conference headquartered elsewhere in the Sydney CBD. My room was about half the price and MUCH nicer than those at the Conference facility. The suite was very clean and well appointed, included a full kitchen and a washer/dryer, and was easy walking distance. Security was also excellent, in that one required a key to both enter the hotel lobby in the evening and to make the lifts work. I was disappointed with the exhorbitent price for internet connectivity, and there was a moderate amount of road noice, but this was still a very worthwhile hotel and one that I would stay in again should business bring me back to the Sydney CBD,

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SarahP1118
Reviews.Content: The Medina Grand Sydney is an excellent home base to explore the city. We opted for a suite with kitchen and laundry facilities, and were pleased with how roomy our accommodations were. The balcony off the kitchen offered great views of the Central Business District. Additionally, the staff was very accommodating, enabling us to leave our luggage at the front desk for our first day in town (we arrived early in Sydney from the U.S., several hours before standard check-in time) as well as use the fitness facilities to shower and freshen up post-flight. Once settled, we were a short walk from Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, the Rocks, and other attractions around Sydney. I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing a clean and comfy place to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good experiance”
Reviews.Author: Sumita_0166
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to stay. It was like home away from home. It was a service appartment, it was well furnished, with all kitchen facility. Darling Harbour, Aquarium, Maritime Museum is on walkable distance. Only one resturant called Grill 511 it serves only breakfast. Very clean hotel. People are very good and helpful. Nice experience

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - if you're looking at family accommodation in Sydney, look no further.”
Reviews.Author: Cynth_an
Reviews.Content: My husband was going on business, and the rest of us decided to tag along. When I was calling around looking for accommodation, Medina Grand were one of the very few that had availability AND reasonable rates. So reasonable compared to other advertised serviced apartments I was sceptical! But they definitely didn't let us down. We were travelling with 3 young children (14 months being the youngest) and the rooms suited us to a tee! Location was ideal - we walked everywhere - Woolworths was up the road, World Square, Darling Harbour, China Town. Plus if you were feeling a bit peckish but couldn't be bothered going too far, there were restaurants and convenience stores virtually downstairs. Rooms met my expectations of a 4.5 star -clean, visually appealing, comfortable beds, functional appliances. The only very very small complaint was the water pressure for the washing machine - it took a while to wash the laundry, but heck that didn't matter much, we were on holidays! Sydney was very humid during the time we went too, but the central AC kicked in fine - we were very comfortable. Oh I did wish that they had a mini vacuum or something - with kids, you'd expect crumbs on the carpet almost instantly, and throughout our stay there, housekeeping did not vacuum the carpets at all. But they did do everything else wonderfully. This stay has opened my eye on all other Medina Grand's - I'd come back to this one for sure next time we're in Sydney next. And would probably highly consider Medina Grands in other cities of Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, very clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: Sparkle59
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff which I always appreciate, great position to Darling Harbour, Pitt Street Mall, lots and lots of eateries near by. We stayed on the 25th floor with not much of a view - never thought to ask for a better view, the rooms were a bit dark as not much light could find its way in as the buildings nearby were so close and tall. The rooms were big and nicely furnished and most importantly of all VERY CLEAN! Kitchen had everything if you wanted to cook and a good sized tv. The pool was lovely and warm. Not alot of street noise so that was great. The only thing that I would like see changed was the bed, comfortable enough but you could feel and hear the springs when you moved about. There is a small cafe downstairs which we had breakfast at - it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great view, great staff = great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marion0709
Reviews.Content: We have just spent two nights at this well appointed establishment and found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The night time view from the 27th floor was amazing. The location is fantastic, only a short five minute walk down Bathurst Street to Darling Harbour, George Street is 2 minutes away, and a variety of shops nearby including a cafe next door, a convenience store and yummy chocolate shop close by. Also worth going to Chef's Gallery a few doors up for a quick, well priced meal. Being in the centre of town,of course there is noise from the street, eg cars, the occasional police siren, etc but that's to be expected, it is the city. Rooms were clean, a good size and well furnitured with comfy couches and large cushions. The gym is well equipped and was vacant both mornings. There seemed to be a mixture of clientele; young people, couples of all ages and families ... indicative of the broad appeal of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tullagirl
Reviews.Content: Arrived early on Saturday morning we were able to check-in. As the room was not ready the staff took our luggage and we were able to use the showers and toilets on the 9th. floor to freshen up after our flight. Received a phone call a couple of hours later to say that our room was ready. When we arrived back at the hotel our luggage was already in the room. The only thing missing in the room was a luggage rack to put your luggage on. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The pillows left a bit to be desired as you needed two on the bed to get a good nights sleep. The menu that was in the room for the restaurant didn't have any prices on it so it was a bit hard to see if it was a good price. We had a studio appartment which was great for the two of us as it had a toaster and microwave so could make your own breakfast. It is only a short walk up to George Street and the Woolworths Supermarket. It is very well located as it is only a short walk to both the market and also Darling Harbour. When we checked out on Sunday morning the staff were again very friendly and held our luggage until the afernoon when we picked it up for our return to the airport. The reception staff booked us a shuttle bus transfer to the airport and when it was late arriving they made a phone call to see where it was without us having to ask them. I think that the staff on the front desk did go out of their way to be helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Frenchy1977
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from the UK as our base for the first couple of days in Oz. We thought we would have an apartment style room with a kitchen, but we had a hotel room with a kitchenette. This was fine for us, but just double check when you book as if we wanted or needed a washing machine we would have been disappointed. The room was lovely, very new and clean, lovely big bathroom. We had a balcony which was a bonus and because we were on the top floor we had a better view than the people on the lower floors as we were on the side of the building, which means view of the side of another building. The location is fab, 5-10 mins walk from the CBD and shops, and 15-20 mins from Circular Quay. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Saraniyan
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Sydney for the second time. I travelled to Sydney in 2005 for the first overseas trip in my life and i stayed in Medina executive in George street. Based on my experience i requested my company for a stay again in the same hotel. I was told that the rooms in that hotel was full and was booked in Medina Grand in Kent Street. I stayed there till Oct 31st. It was marvellous experience there and the way they operate there all your queries are resolved on a timely manner. The cleanliness of the hotel is also very good. The support staff in the reception is also brilliant. My microwave oven was working and it stopped suddenly in between, it was a Sunday and i was promised that by 9 A M my microwave problem will be solved. By 8 30 AM i got a brand new owen and was asked if i was satisfied with its performance. I am not happy only because of this alone, the hospitality is reqlly good and they maintain punctuality as well. How many more times i go to Sydney, i have made up my mind not to stay in any other hotel other than Medina

Reviews.Title: “disabilty friendly with total apartment style comfort, convenience and spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: rubybellissimo
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 3 women, aged 25 to 82, and had a two bedroom apartment with two bathrooms. Could not fault the fit out, it was all newish and functional - own laundry, dishwasher, etc. But I did bring my coffee plunger from home, as there is only a kettle for instant coffee, which is not good enough for us. The lounge, dining, kitchen shared area was spectacular and really spacious with 180 degree views to Darling Harbour and over the city including towards Hyde Park and the Sydney tower. Our apt was a corner suite, hence the views and spaciousness plus we were on the 23rd floor (out of 24). I could not comment on smaller 1 bed apts or those not on the corner, but everyone in the lift seemed very happy to be staying at the Hotel. They also have 3 bed apts. We arrived on Australia Day, 26 Jan, so we saw the fireworks over Darling Habour from our Apt balcony. WOW - that was an unexpected treat. It is a 5 minute walk to Town Hall metro station, and can be done underground if raining or really hot. This train line connects directly to the airports and is about a 20 minute train trip. We took the train both directions,my mother could manage it easily. The train takes about 8 minutes to Circular Quay, where all the action is. The station is disability friendly. For seniors, the trains in Sydney are very cheap. bring your seniors card, many discounts to attractions. Town Hall station has several lines passing through it. The light rail, above ground, also has a stop a few blocks away. The hotel is on the edge of China Town, so we enjoyed the Year of the Rabbit being launched that weekend, too. The adventure shops are on this block, so Kathmandu, Paddy Palin, Mainpeak and more such shops are handy. It is 5 minutes to a Woolworths, open til midnight, by Town Hall station, so easy to shop for food. Queen Victoria Galleries, etc all within 5-10 minutes walk. Lots of cheaper Asian cafes around, as well as Tetsuia's about 5 minutes away if you want to splurge. We splurged at Quay restaurant overlooking the Opera House. Darling Harbour with its abundance of cafes and attractions is 5 minutes downhill from hotel. So - yes, a perfect location. We thought the room was very good value, booked on line with Visa Platinum. First time I had used this site, and saved about $400 over the 5 day stay. This hotel is a good location for people with mobility problems. My mother could manage with her cane as everything was quite flat or there were lifts and escalators everywhere. Also taxis are constantly passing. The hotel recommended the Thai massage a block away and it was far more pleasant than our massage at the Observatory Hotel spa which was 3 times the price. The Thai massage was actually really really good. Great healers. We had a fabulous time and the young desk staff were friendly and helpful. I would return to this hotel even for a romantic holiday as the view is so spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Cdntraveller56
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel in a good location but the front desk staff could learn a thing or two about customer service. We arrived too early to check in so we had to leave our bags with the front desk staff...When we finally did check in we were in a rush to meet friends and it took them over an hour to bring our bags to the room. The room was clean and modern but the bed and pillows were highly uncomfortable. We reserved a cab to go the airport the night before we checked out and when didn't arrive the front desk clerk told us that we'd have to go hail our own taxi in POURING rain... it was less than lovely to sit on a 3 hour flight soaking wet!!

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious, exceptionally clean, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: luvyrlife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights end of November 2010 in a 2 bedroom apartment. As mentioned by previous reviewers excellent set up. Large comfy couch (3 seater) and 2 leather chairs, 2 bathrooms, very quiet room (asked for a quiet room, got level 28, room 129) great kitchen, huge fridge, very comfortable beds and large amount of wardrobe space. Good natural light and small balcony. Little touches were nice, ie fresh milk in fridge replenished every day, a mini bar that is about the same prices as going to the pub, complimentary newspapers. Lots of little cafes around the area to grab breakfast and coffee if you feel like going out versus using your kitchen. Woolworths supermarket 3 minutes walk away, a small convenience store about a minute away. Takes about 8 minutes to get to darling harbour, kings wharf etc. Great meal at a restaurant called Malaya on Kings Wharf. Cinema 3 or 4 minutes walk away too. Railway station across the road. If you are in Sydney on saturday walk up or catch a bus to the Oxford St Markets (Paddington Markets, not to be confused with Paddy's market which is very touristy) - all the locals go here, great takeaway eats, jewellery, art, plants, cafes and shops. Receptionists at Medina Grand were all excellent, very friendly, knowledgable and helpful. Used to stay at the Meriton which I liked a lot for location and space, will now be staying at the Medina Grand.

Reviews.Title: “good location, great appartment”
Reviews.Author: cakeordeathUk
Reviews.Content: really nice friendly staff, appartment plenty big enough for 4 adults. Good location. o complaints at all

Reviews.Title: “No complains and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Vinay17in
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Medina for 5 nights in September. The hotel location is awesome, close darling harbor and lots of good retsaurant. Hotel doesn't have very nice reception/loby but the reception staff are very efficient in doing their job. The room I stayed had decent looking furtniture including a king size bed with nice mattresses. I enjoyed a good night sleep, also a nice view of the city from my room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location,accomodation and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sundy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 12 nights in total having visited the Sunshine Coast inbetween the 12 nights. We arrived very late on the Saturday night after a long flight from UK. The reception staff were nothing more but very courteous and helpful throughout. Our first apartment was on 19th floor and we could not fault it.
