We had 2 bedroomed apartment and the living space was huge. The beds were very comfortable and although we did not use kitchen facilities everything was there and looked brand new. The hotel were happy to keep our luggage we did not need for Sunny Coast and on our return was brought to our 2nd apartment immediately. This one was exactly the same as the first but on a slightly lower floor. The location is ideal, across from Town Hall station and 5 minutes to beautiful Darling Harbour with some fantastic restaurants. Yes, you can hear some traffic noise but you are in the middle of the city, it certainly was not ehough to keep us awake . Would definitely return to these partments.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Zeddog
Reviews.Content: My friend and I loved this place. We booked a 2 bedroom unit for 3 nights and got upgraded to a superior suite on the 26th floor. Fantastic views and a really lovely spacious apartment. Water pressure was a bit poor, but otherwise everything was great. Room was very clean and well furnished. Beaut views and comfy beds. Didn't have any issues with the a/c which seemed perfect for us, so don't know why other reviewers had such a bad time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Gypsywillow
Reviews.Content: We had a Studio Queen apartment with a small view. The air-conditioning was not terrific and the bathroom didn't seem to have a fan at all. The staff were pleasant and the hotel well located opposite the town hall and a short walk to Darling Harbour. We washed the dishes before using them. If you don't mind hearing sirens and street noise, this place is fine, although next time I would have a bigger apartment with seating. The staff were more helpful on check-out then at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL , GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: wedge012
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Medina Grand Sydney form 27/08/10- 02/09/10. Check in desk very efficient and friendly ,helpful staff. Apartments: To die for !!! Had a 2 bed apartment on 26th floor , massive living space ,latest lcd 37" tv ,top of the range hi fi ,dvd player,1 bedroom with twin beds and ensuite + balcony and 1 bedroom with Kingsize and family batroom ,utility room/laundry and the best equipped kitchen i have ever seen. Pool ,gym and sauna ,all seemingly used by very few people as my daughter and i swam everyday and never once were disturbed it was like having our own private pool! Location: 5- 10 minute stroll took you to the heart of Darling Harbour and all its delights,walk the other way and 20 minutes and you were on Circular Quay. Many bars restaurants with in easy walking. One downer was it had no restaurant of its own,only a cafe bar serving brekkies ,lunches and sandwiches. easy walikg to 2 large well known australian supermarkets if you chose to cook yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Poor front desk help when ever you want”
Reviews.Author: Rashit
Reviews.Content: I would like to share my experience at Medina grand through this medium. The location and room quality are good. But the front desk ladies are such a horrible experience, that you ask something from they give it to you after 12 hours. If you leave a message one clerk and then come back to check the response, the other person will not have any idea what has gone with your task. You have to repeat all over again. The internet service provider is another horror story. The toll free number for helpdesk always to Japanese speaking and he says only " no english only japanes" thats all. Poor front desk of this hotel give their deaf ears to since its not their responsibility.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location...Great Room...Perfect Sydney Spot to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shelkers
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great from the beginning with warm welcome from reception staff and an upgrade room for us which was nice. room was so spacious and comfortable. Location Location Location was perfect for what a weekend we required. Excellent pub across the road. Walk to pitt street mall. walk to Darling Harbour/China Town etc. Would recommend this hotel and we cannot wait to go back and stay.

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY ordinary service”
Reviews.Author: lisawarrnambool
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for two nights with 2 teenage children and husband. On arrival was told the 2 bedroom unit with 1 QB and 2 single beds as booked was unavailable, they were sorry but could never guarantee that booking even though I made it 6 weeks ago. My 17 year old son and 13 year old daughter were expected to sleep in a QB together...that didn't go down well and my daughter ended up sleeping on couch. Pillows from cupboard were covered in dust and grime. Staff stated we had been upgraded to room with city views because of this.....big deal, Bathurst St !! Room very noisy with traffic, very difficult to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Unless you like it hot, don't come here”
Reviews.Author: vanderaj
Reviews.Content: My room is currently 30+ C, and possibly as much as 35 C. I can't take any more clothes off, sweating profusely, and angry writing this after just two nights of sweating it out on top of the bed. I asked the desk staff this morning to come fix it, and nothing happened. I opened the door, and it's like a furnace hitting you unlike anything I've experienced other than stepping out in Vegas in the height of August heat. According to the unhelpful staff downstairs tonight, all the rooms share a thermostat and are similarly as hot, so they will not move me. Despite the "air conditioning" tag on the hotel features, don't believe it. You cannot adjust the temperature and it's ridiculously hot in the room. I've had to turn the heater off, and it's stifling in here now that the fan is off. The windows could open onto a balcony, but they're locked shut. Despite that, the hotel is reasonably close to everything. The room is clean and spartan in a modern sort of way. The TV is a bit slow to operate (it takes up to two minutes to recognise the power on button), but the signal quality is good for free to air channels and you get a really a small range of sports jock pay tv channels to the exclusion of useful channels like Discovery or Comedy Channel. I suggest going out at night, especially if you like comfort. Unless you like it REALLY REALLY hot, or come from a tropical clime, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great location, facilities fine, view from our room, nil.”
Reviews.Author: arrowgirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel before and we were travelling with another couple and had a two bedroomed apartment which was spacious and light. This time we were travelling alone and got a studio room which looked out onto the back of another high rise so even in middle of the day you needed the lights on! I couldn't fault the room and the location is great. Walking distance to Darling Harbour, shops in town and trains. I would stay here again but I wouldn't stay in a studio. It was a reasonable price, so I suppose you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: tez823
Reviews.Content: It makes such a difference to stay in a purpose built property. We booked a 1b premier apartment that offered fabulous views from the balcony over Darling Harbour. Apartment comfortably appointed and spacious for the 3 of us. Our whole stay we were not aware of any noise from adjacent apartments even thought the property was full on one night. Opening windows for fresh air were another bonus even though it's quite noisy when you do open them. All the comforts you would expect from a 4* property including a great poo area, in a very convenient location. Located right in the Spanish 1/4 and only a short walk to Darling Harbour, Chinatown, Haymarket and 1 block from Town Hall railway station made for easy access to all of Sydney's attractions. Staff were friendly and helpful and it's nice to have secure on site car parking when visiting the city from the country. The hotel was initially a little difficult to find as it is surrounded by one way streets and our Google maps directions were incorrect (sending us the wrong way up 1 way streets) so would recommend carefully planning your route if driving. Car park entrance is right by hotel entrance and you can drive straight in when you arrive so don't have to fuss around finding a parking spot in order to check in. Our only glitch was that we had booked a rollaway bed and even though I rang the hotel the day before to confirm our booking and advise that we would be arriving late - the rollaway for our 4yo was not in the room at 8pm. It finally arrived after 9pm so we were a little disappointed with this. The good thing was that the rollaway was a "proper" bed with a full thickness mattress not just a flimsy camp style bed like we have had in other major brand name hotels. We took advantage of the order in menu on our first night and were impressed with the meals and service on a Friday night. We also ate breakfast in the cafe one morning and liked the freshly cooked options available (as opposed to hotel buffets). Room was serviced daily and mini-bar replenished daily. All in all - a great 4* hotel experience. We'll be back when next we visit Sydney and would certainly recommend to other families.

Reviews.Title: “Everybody was impressed”
Reviews.Author: Kathiiy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with extended family. We booked two studio rooms and a two bedroom apartment. Staff were VERY helpful with the bulk booking, storing of bags and letting us use toilets and showers in the pool area to change before the rooms were ready. Nobody had any complaints about their rooms, and everyone was impressed with the size and the layout of the two bedroom apartment. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ImmigrantTyke
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a superb position in the centre of the City, just about 5 minutes from Darling Harbour. The harbour has a multiude of restaurants so you will not go hungry. The rooms at the hoel are spacious with the added bonus of a kitchen area and balcony. Our room was on the 29th floor so the view was amazing although not good if you suffer from vertigo. Buses and trains are both within a one minute walk and you can gert to the hotel by Mini coach or train from the airport. Taxis will cost about Â£50. The trian station is Town Hall. Highly receommenede hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst accomodation of my life...”
Reviews.Author: journeywings
Reviews.Content: The two coldest, dampest, most stressful nights... Medina has a major central heating/cooling system issue. Unfortunately these were the coldest October days on record for Sydney - non stop rain and temps around 14. Medina Grand had no heating because they had switched the system to summer setting and staff were not able to change it back! We only found this out after turning the thermostat up in our room and leaving it for an hour thinking it might take time to kick in... meanwhile the system blew out cold air and the room temp kept dropping! I had a newborn with me and a toddler - it was so bad we had to buy fleecy tracksuits to wear over their PJs, and my baby was covered with cold damp throw rugs. So of course I couldn't sleep because I was freezing myself and was so worried that my baby would be smoothered in the excess layers, or would get a chill. Everything was damp due to the weather and no heating. It was the most unpleasant experience I have ever had. Aside from that the rooms are darkly furnished which added to the general feeling of despair. Staff said they knew about the problem and it was building-wide and they couldn't get anyone to look at it because it was the weekend. I put a complaint in writing to Medina and got no response. My husband had the misfortune to have to stay there again 6 months later and it had the same problem. Definately avoid this place unless the weather is perfectly in tune with their central heating and cooling system or you will freeze. We also had very slow service in the restaurant - because they were at full occupancy, we had to line up for breakfast, and once seated, there was a long wait for food and order was mucked up. Also, note the studio apartment has no kitchen so just a hotel room really. I can overlook most things, but heating is a bare necessity in a cold climate.

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: marcopolo1701
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Medina in a studio apt, queen size bed, good size bathroom and adequate kitchenette with fridge, microwave, iron & ironing board. Good internet access at a reasonable fee and TV with minimal foxtel channels and no free to view. Desk service was adequate but the cost of incidentals was high $80AU for a 1300hrs checkout, the latest time to checkout. The minibar and water were expensive so buy from the bottle o across from the Townhall there is also a Wollies there too. Handy for the amenities of SYD, The rocks/Circular quay 20 mins walk, Darling Harbour 10 min walk. A good place to stay for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “great location, poor balcony view but room comforable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Miss76
Reviews.Content: recently refurb'd room on high floor made stay a pleasant one, bathrooms nice size but no window. Balcony view looking directly onto next building! staff friendly but watch mini-bar - I was charged the whole cost of all minibar items although i only removed items from fridge to make space in fridge. For a self contained room - fridge would benefit from being larger. I was refunded the amount but after calling to investigate whilst noticing the charge on my bank account - no notification came from the hotel at all. otherwise, locality is idea for transport and darling harbour. will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the 'Grand' fool you”
Reviews.Author: eimaj007
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a number of Medina hotels over the years and it seems to me that the brand is pretty much hit and miss. After checking in Friday afternoon, I suffered a number of issues with accessing my room due to the room being double locked. After a lot of waiting for lifts (probably about 15 mins in total due to lifts being taken up by construction crews) I was able to access my room with kitchenette. First impressions: The kitchenette is exactly that. I would summarise as an additional sink and a microwave, which is probably what most would expect but I've seen better. Great for reheating, but it ends there. Views: From my level 19 room looking straight ahead, all I can see is a wall. If you go out on the balcony and look to the extreme left or right you can see city, but at a stretch. Advice, don't let the views on the website fool you and if views are really important, maybe request at time of booking. Service: After the first night I forgot to put my towels in the bath tub to have them replaced and upon returning that afternoon, I realised that my towel hadn't dried and I'd need some more. First phone call to reception - 'Not a problem, we'll send some up'. Two hours later and a second call to reception 'I'll organise that straight away for you'. Third phone call to reception and 'We'll send them straight up'. Eventually (3.5 hours later) I was in possession of some fresh towels, although on a side note the towels resemble what you'd usually class as 'old' towels at home used for mopping up spills etc. Overall, acceptable but I wouldn't be in a rush to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but basic”
Reviews.Author: peter1007
Reviews.Content: Arrived about 9.30 pm - surprised that I needed to ring a night bell to access. Receptionist polite and efficient. She took a telephone call during the check-in and seemed to automatically start over when she got back to me. Thought this was interesting - but examcply the same happened with a different person on check-out. Seems to be a set presentation - but comes across as impersonal. Nothin open to eat at the hotel - but alot of local eateries locally Sign identified hotel was undergoing refurbishment. Seems I got a room before refurbishment. Clean, worn, fairly basic for a 4.5 star hotel. Looked at hotel cafe for breakfast - but opted for nearby Hilton (exensive but very good). All in all, convenient to my business needs, but would look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, well appointed hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Elzed
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable, well appointed hotel. The studio room was large with plenty of storage space and the kitchen area included everything that was needed. The bathroom was also large and included extras such as shampoo, body lotion, etc. The hotel was very central and within easy walking distance of Darling Harbour but also within walking distance of Circular Quay and the Botanic Gardens. The only slight downside was that the airconditioning was "humming" which was not a problem during the day but noticeable at night and also some traffic noise could be heard. Apart from that we would recommend this hotel and would stay there again if the opportunity arose.

Reviews.Title: “A good option for families”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Undercover
Reviews.Content: Having read a few TA and other reports on this aparthotel after booking I did wonder what I was going to find. Thankfully our findings and experiences were positive. With a family of four, including two teenagers, this aparthotel option was more favourable than two hotel rooms. It also gave us the added advantage of much more space and the freedom of being able to make hot drinks, snacks etc. when we wanted to (oh and wash clothes as each apartment had a washing machine and dryer). Our two bedroom apartment was large and well appointed. Ideal for our needs and would suit a family like ours, or a group of friends. Well located with in easy walk of most of Sydney's sights - plus the railway station just up the road. Woolworths 5 minutes walk for groceries. Only grumble about the apartment was the dirty looking carpets (why furnish with a light grey carpet as stains and dirt will show up more?). Staff were accommodating. We arrived early after a long flight from London and were allowed to use the pool/fitness club shower facilities and change clothes. Baggage willing stored and already in our apartment when we returned later in the afternoon after exploring Sydney. Also, reception very helpful in checking me in on line for our domestic flights and printing off boarding cards. All in all - a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: digitium
Reviews.Content: a short walk from Darling Harbour and Town Hall, this well located and well appointed Hotel was nothing but bliss. The 2-bedroom apartment we had came with a large living area with spectacular views of the city. At the corner where the Dining Table was set, you could actually have a 270 degrees view. Price was definitely reasonable for the quality of the room. Toilets were clean and everything worked well (no cheap nor poorly maintained equipment). The kitchen allowed us to whip up light meals at ease, and we routinely ate breakfast in the apartment, having bought the raw food (eggs, bread, bacon...) from the Coles just down the road. Shopping can be found all over the place, and hundreds of food places are within a hundred metres of the hotel. Even Chinatown was practically just down the street, and we just had to walk to get to anywhere we wanted. And if it was further, we would take the highly efficient Sydney Trains and Ferries which served us well during the 6 days that we were there. The only problem was getting a spot to drop and pick us and our huge load of baggage. But we eventually made do.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sandra2811
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a premier 2 bedroom apartment. It was serviced everyday, we had a great views of Darling Harbour and centerpoint tower.It was a nice walk to everything .We had full kitchen, two bathrooms and full laundry. All the staff were great and the lifts were fine.Apartment was nice and large, when the curtains in the bedroom were closed the rooms were very dark, ideal for sleeping. We will tell all of our friends to stay here and next time we are in Sydney we will be back here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but tired/worn decor and not very clean”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTravellers57
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment, the room layout was great, location for nearby sightseeing was excellent but the room was very tired. The paint was worn and knocked, carpet stained, holes in the net curtains over the windows and the kitchen was dirty, had not been cleaned properly for some time. The kitchen bench was marked with burns from hot pots, the cupboard doors and fridge door were grimy, the kitchen window blind covered in sticky dust. Definately not 4 star accommodation, it is way overdue for an update and would look at other options before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment Style Accomodation in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: MaKSiNG
Reviews.Content: Service: Nothing special. Very average for a hotel of this class. Room: We were in a Studio which was small but adequate. They call them apartments but you only get a fridge and microwave no hob to cook on. The rooms are in very good condition and seem very new. There is lots of wardrobe space if you are into that kind of thing. Nice to have a balcony too especially if you are on the 26th floor as we were. Gorgeous views over a glass of wine. Bathroom: Very clean and new looking. Good size. Location: Very close to Chinatown. 10 mins walk to City CBD (King St). And 10 mins walk to Darling Harbour. Additional: As they are apartments I presume people do stay there on a longer basis and I could most certainly imagine myself staying here for longer.

Reviews.Title: “the worst 4 star”
Reviews.Author: dolinloop
Reviews.Content: I'm astonished that this service apartment is qualified as 4 star accommodation. I would say it's 3 star if i'm generous. The furniture in the room are very basic and old. The chair is not comfortable and full of scratches. The soft decoration, carpet, bed sets are very old and the color has faded. The lights are dim and unwelcome. When i first checked in, I found hair (not my color) on the towel and hair pin on the carpet. And the hair pin stayed untouched during my whole stay.... they made bed, empty the dustbin, that's all... Internet is charged at $25 per day. When I asked for cable, reception firstly gave me a 10cm one, which couldn't connect my laptop to the socket. Then they provided a longer one, but again it's useless as the plugs are broken. It's the worst 4 star accommodation experience. Won't stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WexfordGirl17
Reviews.Content: Great service. Ideal location for young adults travelling. Had a two bed apartment for four people ideal. Would defiantly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment, would stay there again if lifts work!”
Reviews.Author: AxellaJ
Reviews.Content: We chose this accommodation based upon the good reviews, and were not disappointed. While it was not perfect, it made for a pleasant stay. It was spacious, clean, and well-appointed (I've uploaded a video of our apartment so you can see for yourselves). As we got a "last-minute" rate on-line, it was a great deal. It was a lot cheaper for us, three adult females, than two hotel rooms would have been. We were able to eat breakfast and dinner in, most nights (Safeway was just around the corner), which saved us a lot of money. All of the basic utensils you'd need to prepare and eat a meal, are provided. The kitchen has a stove, oven, microwave, dishwasher, electric kettle, toaster, and full-sized fridge as well as pots and pans, dishes, glassware, and cutlery. A 250ml (8oz) container of milk is provided gratis, which was good for us for coffee the first morning, as we arrived at night. All other things provided (except instant coffee, teabags, and sugar) are "mini bar expensive". The next morning I went to Safeway and got some essentials. The beds were comfortable enough and all came with doonas with removable covers (so I'm assuming they are washed more than typical hotel bedspreads as they looked clean). Sheets and towels were all of high quality. Our 2BR apt had two bathrooms, one an en-suite attached to the "master" bedroom. It contained a sink, shower, and toilet (the shower control works very easily, and as it's right next to the soap dish, be careful not to knock it while reaching blindly for the soap or washcloth, or you'll get burnt or frozen! It was quite a shock!). The other "main" bathroom had a shower-over-bath, sink, and toilet. Water pressure was great in both. Both bathrooms had shelves above the sinks for cosmetics and sundries, very handy, and both were modern and clean. And the main bathroom had a retractable clothesline over the tub, as well as a cupboard which contained the washer, dryer, and ironing implements. You really could live there! All carpets were clean and unstained, the furniture likewise. We didn't hear any "street noise" worthy of note up on the 29th floor. I know others have mentioned it, so maybe there was some event on at that time. We were there for 3 weeknights, so maybe the weekends are noisier? Location-wise, it was excellent. Town Hall (train) station was about a minute away on foot, as were many shops and restaurants (the Medina has a breakfast cafe, but we didn't go there. There is also Tom & Tom's Coffee next door). Darling Harbour was a short walk, and Circular Quay (up in the vicinity of the Bridge and Opera House) was about a 15-20 minute pleasant walk. We were easily able to walk to the Aquarium. For those who aren't into walking too much, the train from Town Hall Station arrived at Circular Quay in two stops. While the girls climbed the Bridge, I took a Harbour tour on Captain Cook Cruises. It was breathtaking and I'd do it again in a heartbeat. I got some great photos (including the girls climbing on the bridge!). As it's a "hop on/hop off" tour ticket, it stops at many sites of interest aroudn the Harbour. And I was able to get off at Pier 26, close to my hotel. Fantastic! I was surprised to find that there were no public internet facilities for guests. To be fair, each unit has internet facilities as long as you bring your laptop (we didn't, as we had to leave our bags in the car for a few hours prior to flying to Sydney and were afraid of theft). We incorrectly assumed that there would be one or two PCs in a public room or Business Centre that we could use for checking email, and whatever else. Not so. We were directed to a local convenience store which offered cheap internet, but man, were those computers grubby, and I wasn't comfortable typing my passwords into those machines. So I used my phone's internet capabilities, instead. There was a gym and pool but we neither used nor saw either as we had only a few days to take in the sights of Sydney. One complaint we all had (and I mean EVERYONE, not just us) was the sad state of the lifts. There are only two, and one was out of order. One lift for 29 floors worth of guests was ridiculous, and it usually meant a LONG wait for it to collect us at the top floor, and another long wait in a can of sardines as it stopped at virtually every floor on the way down. There does not appear to be a service lift, since we often had to share with housekeeping carts and the like, which was ridiculous. I was told by a lift worker that the broken lift is problematic, has broken down before, and needs big $$ spent on it (I got the impression that they keep doing band-aid fixes). I asked what would happen if BOTH lifts broke and the guy said with a chuckle, "You'd be doing a lot of stair climbing" (I don't THINK so!). He said that even having two working lifts was inadequate for a building this size. Climbing twenty-nine flights would simply be unacceptable. I'd need a holiday after my holiday! I would ask them to collect my things, check me out, and put me and my arthritic knees up elsewhere! For others like me, the lift situation may be something to enquire about before booking, I think! I shudder to think what a disabled person would do! Your apartment can be serviced daily, if needed. We found that although the "do not disturb" sign was hung on the door (the flip side was "Please make up my room"), housekeeping had come in as the bath mat was rolled up when I returned. I think it's primarily to count mini-bar items. Overall, we had a pleasant stay at the Medina Sydney Central. Other than the lift thing, I would happily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good apartment hotel right in the heart of the CBD”
Reviews.Author: karzrao
Reviews.Content: If your looking for an apartment hotel, this one is not too bad. I was given a studio room on the top most floor on the building. There is nothing fancy about this hotel, but it is clean and good for the price. Also, the location of the hotel is right in the heart of the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: OzOlive
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on a business trip. Room was spacious enough with balcony, queen bed & desk. Kitchenette included microwave, toaster, fridge and crockery etc which was useful. Bed was surprisingly comfortable despite being basic and all linens clean but tired looking. The noise level from the street was very loud despite being on level 27. I barely slept. This is not within the hotel's control obviously and is the price you pay for being in such a central location. Only a 5 or 10 minute walk to the restaurants at Darling Harbour. No restaurant in hotel but not a problem as you are spolied for choice locally. Breakfast served in cafe downstairs was fine, nothing exciting but cheap by Sydney standards. Hotel pool was plesant although not lit at 6am when it opened so had to swim in semi-darkness.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spacious apartment. Definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Balobonsai
Reviews.Content: Great location! We stayed in a Two Bedroom apartment and the size was great. The fact that there were also two bathrooms meant we could all get ready in the morning much faster. We've stayed in other places before with only one bathroom for two bedrooms. We hardly used the kitchen, but it was well enough appointed that you could cook something for yourself if you wanted to. There was a restaurant that we didn't use - as the hotel is only a few minutes walk from Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay Wharf. There was also a range of menus which were available for delivery to our room from outside establishments. Did not use the gym, but the pool was very welcome on our 40+ degree day in Sydney, and had surprisingly few people using it considering the temperature outside. Also, given the fact that the hotel was located in the middle of a busy city, we found it to be quite quiet. Only concerns were firstly with the single beds in the second bedroom, they were able to be zipped into one larger bed, which I know is quite normal, but when separated, they were extremely soft and rather narrow. The other issue was the extreme price of the in-room broadband internet. The plans appeared complicated in their explanation, and I think I would have had to pay $90 per day for access. This was ridiculous, so I went without. Overall, would recommend the room, space and facilities could not be faulted. Staff were helpful and very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Great Views”
Reviews.Author: EleMartin
Reviews.Content: We spent the Australia Day LW here and loved it, it was in a great location, close to the City and Darling Harbour. The apartment was spacious with a large curved corner window that overlooked the city in the main lounge area, this gave the apartment excellent views from our 21st floor. It actually rained on the eve of Australia day, however from the balcony (connected to the main bedroom) and the curved window we were able to watch the fireworks at Darling Harbour. The pool was also nice, although a small conference was on at the time and with the delegates in the foyer and in the conference room they were able to stand / sit around watching us, may be better if they frosted the windows! It wasnt the cheapest, but generally good value for money, especially as it was over a long weekend We will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: agentc
Reviews.Content: My friend arranged a two night stay here for a good rate and it was great. Although we got the Studio apartment at the very top floor with the balcony overlooking Bathurst St, I wasn't complaning. Nice room, TV even had Fox Sports. The location is convenient to Town Hall station and to shops. I enjoyed the stay and my friend like it a lot that we stayed an extra night. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but micro studio”
Reviews.Author: melbxyxyx
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous. I had a studio room, which was the size of a small hotel room with a toaster and microwave stuck in the corner. Not even an easy chair. A micro balcony with no furniture. If you're expecting a studio apartment, you'll be disappointed. If you want a hotel room with a microwave - this is it! Gym has rather old and knackered equipment, and small. Lifts kind of slow (only two and a lot of floors!). If you get the rate including breakfast, its a nice continental self-service. Which made my rate pretty reasonable for Sydney CBD. Friendly and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: MRXTCZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Medina grand in late October.. Had booked a Studio Room.. later to realse that there was no kitchennete, so i called reception and asked them if they would upgrade me.. they certainly upgraded!! 1 Bedroom Premier Apartment .. very very high floor .. think it was level 26 .. The room was spectacular, all the furnishing was up to date, clean smell. with a mini lil balcony out front. The view of the harbour was great, and a great view of the Harbour.. and as a bonus the Hillsong group were having an event and we got front row seats to FIREWORKS! The pool, gym and sauna was great! worked out .. then sweat it off .. and cool down in the pool .. it was heavenly .. Outside atmosphere is great. Top notch apartments .. recommended for sure. Will be staying next time for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Very ordinary”
Reviews.Author: tal27
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 weeks in a one bedroom apartment about halfway up (15th floor I think). View was straight up Bathurst Street (ie no view). I was there during world youth week, and I had a lot of trouble with noise. This is in a quieter part of town normally, but the noise of cars and people is very audible, even with all doors shut and curtains closed. The party may as well have been in my room. You also get the noise of churchbells from just up the road, but this is not as annoying by itself, and is not constant of course. Just very loud. The staff were very helpful, but the place was so tired looking. It looked exactly what it was - an overcleaned, overused serviced apartment. There were marks and stains on everything, the kitchen was not very good - very grubby and lacking basic utensils - no chopping knives or boards (previous occupiers had clearly just used the laminate worktop to chop things), dirty pans and a kettle that was so awful I had to scrub and boil it about 4 times before it was approaching usable. The first thing I did on arrival was put everything through the dishwasher or washed it up myself. On the plus side, it was spacious, with a large bathroom (shower over the rather shallow tub), and a very useful utility area with a washing machine and dryer. The layout was well designed. The television was very old fashioned, and did require a lot of manual button pushing (ie the remote only changed channels really - I had to switch on and off on the set, and also adjust the volume on the set), plus it was a small old screen). There was a hosuekeeping service every day which varied according to who you got. Each cleaner seemed to have their own idea as to what they would do or not do, which made it quite interesting in some ways to see at night what had been done that day. The "gym" is tiny, and consists of one treadmill, a couple of bikes and a few free weights. The pool also is more of a tiny lap pool, better for splashing in. I only saw one other person there during my whole stay. The lifts are very very slow, they tend to shut one down a lot, and then it is all stops up and down. Not a large lift either - 4 people and luggage and it is bursting. Whilst I was there, the apartment next door was rented by a family for a week, and the cooking smells did permeate the hallway, and under my door - I knew what they were eating 3 times a day. Not very effective ventilation. I realise this can be an issue in all apartment blocks, but the low ceilings really did cause smells to linger nastily. As a whole, I would not recommend it - location is pretty ordinary, and the apartments are tired. The staff are generally very friendly tho'. I did have one issue on the last day when I specifically called down to reception to request an extra hour to check out. This was readily granted, but then at exactly one minute past the normal check out time I received a call reminding me of the time and asking me in a rather rude abrupt tone why I had not yet left? Not a great last impression at all.

Reviews.Title: “SAD SHAPE DIRTY and NO CS”
Reviews.Author: TheCoffeeQueen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Medina Grand Sydney on Kent from 26-30 April, 2008 for business. I have had a terrible experience I spoke to reception starting the first night regarding: internet questions-said can't help you, a bunch of people were in the hotel and very loud/partying, cig. smoke coming into my room via the air vents, screaming at the elevator and the room was dirty (stain splatters on the curtains/stains on the carpet/in the shower). I called reception and was treated rudely and told: we are full just mail the comment card in. I asked for a manager on duty and told try tomorrow morning no one is hear that can help you. Then I went down to plead with reception (another person) to help me the next morning, The offer was to move me (to a lesser room-no view and on a lower floor) or I have to pay more for a better room (only thing better was the view). I had a fine view bbefore it was the filth and noise and cigarette smoke that was the problem. Then spoke to the manager and he said nothing we can really do, and then sent a note to me for a $40 credit- that is it! So much for hospitality or working with your customers. My internet was all that may cover for the 4 days. I am back to the hotel on last night and my final straw . The temp control was not working and my room was very hot. They said they have gone to heat and I can not use the temperature control in my own room to lower how hot it is-they have central control so I have to suffer with it being to hot. I am at my end with it hear and can't wait to leave. This hotel is in a good location for the city (close to the harbor) but it is Sad Sad Sad and in desperate need of a complete renovation from staff to rooms. If it is the cheapest then maybe stay but no way would I ever come here again. Terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Sydney High”
Reviews.Author: jon1949
Reviews.Content: Great views from 29th.floor. Clean comfortable room with kitchenette. Life in the city centre! walking distance to Darling Harbour. Good selection of bars, internet cafes and eating places in locality. Short taxi ride to Station. Perfectly adequate for a city stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth sailing at the Medina Grand”
Reviews.Author: Haggis45
Reviews.Content: I booked a studio room direct with the hotel for $160 a night on the entertainment card rate for my 2 night stay. We have stayed there a couple of times now and keep coming back as the location suits us. It's an easy walk to Darling Harbour, as well as the city shopping and Chinatown. Very convenient to Town Hall station so I caught the airport express and walked to the hotel. The studio room is compact but has the kitchenette which is very handy. Bed was comfy and there was a selection of pillows. Bathroom clean, good water pressure and I liked the fact there was a balcony so you can open the sliding door to get fresh air in - and check the morning air temperature! No complaints - check in/out was smooth, but I didn't need anything during my stay. The pool area is great - water is warm and the gym had everything you would need. I think it's good value for money for what I paid and would stay there again. Beware the closing door of the fire escape - my niece decided to speak on the phone to her boyfriend late at night in the stairwell to avoid waking guests (and me), but had to descend to the ground floor in her night wear to re enter past reception. Nothing to do with the hotel, but a funny moment of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible but not great”
Reviews.Author: Ganagirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this last minute based on location and price and was expecting it to be not as good as the brilliant place I had been in. I was right. The check in was great and they were incredibly helpful at getting me into a room early. The room smelt of smoke although they assured me it was non-smoking etc. I ended up with a little machine blasting on all day to clear the smell which it did,alongside opening the balcony door. It felt a bit jaded, furnishings, the bathroom with two plugs that fitted neither bath nor sink although it had a big bath which was nice...well would have been if I could have had one! Kitchen was teeny tiny and barely lit although had pretty much everything I needed for a couple of nights. No laundry facility in room. It was lovely to have a balcony and a good view over the city No ethernet cable and a $50 deposit for a very short one - wonder where they buy theirs form as I bought a 3m one from Dick Smith for under $20!, The internet kept dropping out due to some recurring technical issue. Not very impressive if you're trying to conduct meetings online. Still it was fixed relatively quickly, couple of hours, Lifts were very slow and seemed to stop at every floor and the lift access card didnt work once which was a little nerve wracking. It was very clean and house keeping were friendly and helpful. Shouldn't have been disappointed I suppose, but I was.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: ozmatt07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Medina Grand as part of a work trip. The hotel upgraded myself and a colleague to a 2 bedroom apartment which was huge & had everything we needed. Great beds & bathrooms & nice hotel. Location was good, not far to walk to the city mall or the convention centre. monorail was nearby too. They dodn't have meals at the hotel and that's because it was an apartment. There was a cafe downstairs and it served a nice breakfast but there is a supermarket nearby. Good luck finding a taxi driver who knows where anything is in Sydney so grab a card with the address on it at check in - saves time driving to the wrong places. Great hotel, great staff & would reccommend them. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic free upgrade....”
Reviews.Author: Jenntay
Reviews.Content: My 12 year old daughter and I have just returned from a week at the Medina Grand. On arrival, we were greeted by the friendly and courteous receptionist and the news that we had received a free upgrade from a one bedroom to two bedroom apartment. Fantastic! The two bedroom apartment was on the second to top floor with panoramic views of Darling Harbour and the CBD. It was spacious, light and airy. The furniture was new and smart, the decor attractive (not all black and white but some subtle colour) and the large beds extremely comfortable. The airconditioning was effective but it was also great to have the options of opening windows and stepping out on to the balcony. The bathrooms were large and well equipped. There was only minimal traffic noise and no noticeable sound from the adjacent apartments. Both my daughter and I slept well. The apartments were serviced each day (to a higher standard than many similar apartments in which I have stayed in the past) and the room service person was polite and friendly when we encountered her. The only downsides - a dishwasher that was hard to start (but then the room service attendant would turn it on for us anyway) and a slight delay on collecting our bags on the day we checked out (but then it was a public holiday, Australia Day, and the apartment may have been shortstaffed). The location is excellent, with an easy walk to most amenities and attractions and a large choice of dining options nearby. The staff were helpful in suggesting where to go to eat and how to catch transport etc. I would recommend the Medina Grand highly and would certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Not much of an *apartment*”
Reviews.Author: villdre
Reviews.Content: Positives: 1) Nice and clean 2) Courteous Staff 3) Very good location (for tourists and business-travelers) 4) Internet is probably cheaper than most hotels ($12 for one hour, $24 for a 24 hour block). Negatives: 1) Floor smelled of cigarettes (I might have been on a smoking floor) 2) "Apartment" only had a microwave and a bar-fridge - not much of a kitchen(ette). 3) Bed was uncomfortable - quilt was tucked tight and low ... I struggled to get it upto my chest (and I'm not tall). This seems a common theme across all Medinas. 4) "Apartment" was tiny 5) View was nothing to write home about 6) Power button on TV remote would NOT turn the TV off. It would just bring me to the Pay-per view menu. What I cannot judge: 1) Pool & Gym - never went there 2) Parking - never used it 3) Porter service - never used it

Reviews.Title: “Medina met the requirements”
Reviews.Author: K_K_travellers
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed with Medina Executive in St. Kilda, Melbourne, the expectations were not very high. We got a very nice twin bed studio on the 21st floor. The studio had a balcony with 2 chairs and was facing an office building across the street. It was clean, quiet (from traffic noise) and had everything we needed. The beds were once again very good. The service from the reception and the staff was very good, and at the level you would expect from a 4* hotel. The location is ok, as it takes about 25 min. to walk to the Opera House, less than 10 minutes to Darling Harbor and 5 min. to the tube station.. The main problem was the noise from the neighboring doors being shut. The door handle outside the doors are locked when the doors are shut from outside, and hence makes a terrible bang when the doors are being closed. Having neighbors in and out the doors several times early in the morning or very late at night, disturbs a good night sleep. This is a sort of a contradiction to the fact that when you check in you have to sign a document saying that disturbing other guests by parting, etc. gives the hotel a right to ask you to leave the premises.

Reviews.Title: “I am not happy about the procedure to confirm my booking”
Reviews.Author: bida53
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel online for New Years Eve but when it came to confirm our booking actual copies of credit cards both sides and passports were required which made us very uncomfortable about the security of the booking process. No other hotel has ever asked me for this amount of proof for booking. Felt bullied into giving it all in fear of loosing the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: mel1Melbourne
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 4 nights at this hotel and loved it! We were upgraded on arrival to a one bedroom apartment on the 23rd floor with a balcony and amazing views of Darling Harbour and the city. The apartment was spacious, spotless and extremely comfortable. The hotel was not noisy - we couldn't hear the traffic or our neighbours and it had all the amenities we could have wanted (including foxtel which we are sadly addicted to now!). The hotel pool and sauna was very nice and the hotel staff were all very helpful. It was only about 5 minutes or so walk to Darling Harbour and a couple of minutes to Town Hall station so the location was perfect for us! We will definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: asaus
Reviews.Content: Booked Standard Studio Room. Excellent value for location. Very close to Town Hall Station, Major shopping and entertianment district. Short pleasent walk to Darling Harbour (mostly down hill). Room was clean and not overly worn. Although the bed was a bit soft for my liking. Small patio gave great view over the city. Very handy microwave oven, coffe and tea making. For a stay in Sydney you could pay alot more and get a lot less. Recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Medina Grand”
Reviews.Author: yougorgeousthing
Reviews.Content: Everytime I visit Sydney I always stay here. I have tried out other hotels nearby, but I keep coming back to the Medina Grand. I feel like Iam at home. The apartments are so spacious with a hotel feeling. Clean and modern. Everything is there all the kitchen appliances and laundry facilities. Amazing view from the living room! The bed and pillows are so comfortable and there was hardly any noise very quiet. Great sleep! I love the location. It is so close to Chinatown amongst all the eateries and across the road is QVB where all the shopping is! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, great location”
Reviews.Author: stonebrigger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2004. Had a lovely room which was spacious and very clean. Location was excellent, 5 minutes to Darling Harbour. would recommend these apartments to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: ExpectationsSydney
Reviews.Content: I had booked 2 nights in a 1 bedroom apartment via wotif.com.au and managed to secure a good rate for a Thursday and Friday night. Checked in at 2.00pm on the Thursday and realised that the air conditioning was not operating correctly in the apartment. Just fortunate that it was not summer. After a restless sleep, i advised the front desk. The problem was corrected during the following morning. The shower in the apartment was unusual. It had the facility for a disabled guest, yet when using the hand held nozzle, water would seep under the glass and almost flood the bathroom (strange set up) One final small concern. When i checked out on the Saturday morning, i was told that there was a mobile phone cost billed to my room. I advised the clerk at reception that i had not made any calls at all (she was pleasant enough and discarded the cost) Thinking back, perhaps the maintenace people may have used the phone?? Overall, my stay was pleasant and found the staff helpful. The 1 bedroom apartment is very roomy and comfortable. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Disapponting....”
Reviews.Author: koko1978
Reviews.Content: We stay for 6 nights at the Grand Medina Sydney. I must admit that after my great experience in the Grand Medina Melbourne i had high hopes about this hotel, but the reality was totally the opposite. We were a party of 5 adults, and all the fifth of us went to the reception for the check-in at 12 PM. Since the check in time was 2 PM, the told us our room was going to be ready for that hour. We went for a walk and we came back the room was ready. We went to our apartment, and to our surprise the room was a 2 bedroom WITHOUT an extra bed. (Notice that the woman in the reception saw we were five but arrange the room only for 4...). We checked our vouchers and it said that we had booked a THREE bedroom apartement. We went to reception and showed - AGAIN - the voucher and empahside the fact that we had a 3 bedroom apartement. As logic indicates, the moved us to a 3 - bedroom apartment. After losing a lot of time, we left the hotel to go and enjoy the city. When we came back, in our room we had a note from a man named Robert something. He said that if we wanted to stay in that apartemente we had to pay an extra 200 Dollars per night since, in spite of what the voucher said, our travel agent had booked us a 2 bedroom apartment. We understood that our travel agent made the mistake, so 5 minutes after reading that note we went to the reception and told them that we were not going to pay that diference, that we wanted to move again to the 2 bedroom but, this time, with the extra bed. The answer from the man of the reception was that since this guy Robert went home he couldnÂ´t anything..... After speaking whit him and made him understand that if that night they left us in that room, under NO circustances we were going to pay the extra 200 dolars, he said that nobody coud help us in the hotel because robert went home and that all he could say. We finally stay that night in that apartment and first thing the next morning we spoke with this Robert and explain him the whole situation. BUT HE SAID THAT, in spite that we BEG them to move us to a 2 bedroom the night before, WE HAD TO PAY THE 200 DOLLARS for the night. We told him that we were not going to pay for that, so he said he would speak to out travel agent in Australia and see if they would pay for that difference and he PROMISED he would give an aswer that day. And we also asked him to move us again to a 2 bedroom w extra bed.. Guess what happen? Till the end of our stay we never had any news from Robert and that day when we came back to the hotel we had the 2 bedroom apartmente...but WITHOUT THE EXTRA BED. After we went to the reception and complaint about it, they finally gave us the extra bed. A few days later, one of the guys of the reception (the only one that had manners and cared about the guests) told me "off the record" that he heard our australian travel agente was going to pay for the difference (which, btw, i think thay shouldnt because that first night we specifically told them we wanted the 2 bedroom Netiher this guy Robert nor any other person apologize for the inconvinience or helped in other way during our stay. They made us waste a lot of time and made us worried fot this situation mucho more than we should. Yes, the hotel has good location, and little les.

Reviews.Title: “A big Suprise!”
Reviews.Author: casualvisitorss
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a last minute deal on wotif.com and were suitably suprised at the excellent service and quality of the accommodation provided. We arrived at 1pm (slightly earlier than the check in time) and the staff were happy to assign us to a room that had already been cleaned - by default we were lucky enough to score an upgrade. The room was in excellent condition with new furnishings and plenty of room. We easily parked our car in their secure car park (included in the price) and then explored Sydney which was at our doorstep - really! Our check out was just as effortless and being a public holiday we were hoping to leave the car in their secure car park - again no problem and at no extra charge. Fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Rude & Noisy.. what ever you do.. Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: margienat
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed 2 nights at Medina Grand Sydney (Cnr Kent & Bathurst). I travel to Sydney and many places around the world for business and have stayed in a lot of places. This was the first & may I say the last time I shall stay at this property. Both the service and the general attitude demonstrated by the staff falls very short of what I would consider acceptable. The rooms are small and you can hardly move around.. for the price you pay.. you really feel cheated. We arrived on Monday & upon arrival we were greeted by a very rude disgruntled employee.. I could hardly hear her over the counter.. through the very loud Jack hammer noise outside the front door. We were staying on the 10th floor and could hear the jack hammer noise throughout the day... and did not enjoy waking up first thing Tuesday early to the noise of it. The final straw of our 3 day disaster stay was the constant harassment by the staff the morning of our check out. After calling reception and trying to orgainse a later check out.. as (10.00am) was the listed time.. We were then called about 5 times by both male & female reception staff. Asking about what time we were checking out.. This situation of "the left hand not knowing what the right hand was doing".. very unprofessional.. When we did check out. about 12.00... the girl on reception again was very short rude and disinterested.. she didn't ask as to why we requested a slightly longer stay.. nor did she ask if we enjoyed our stay. We had put up with "jack hammer noises" for the last few days.. NOT complained one bit.. and then they decide to be totally inflexible..?.. Just not good enough.. There are heaps of places to stay in Sydney.. just dont stay here... A very disappointed guest..

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Chris004
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment. Had good kitchen facilities, excellent laundry facilities and 2 bathrooms. Reception staff were unfailingly polite and helpful - and didn't gloat too much over the cricket results!!! Less than 15 minutes walk to Darling Harbour with aquarium, ferry terminal, bars and restaurants. Access to shopping mall and QVB shopping centre diagonally opposite - also to 'Town Hall' station - 5 - 10 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: cec03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Medina apartment for four nights in July 2005; me, my husband and our 10- year old daughter. The location was excellent. You could easily walk to Darling Harbour, Sydney Aquarium, Chinatown, Sydney Tower etc., and a little longer walk took you to the Opera House. The apartment we stayed in was great. Comfortable living room, nice bedroom, splendid kitchen and a magnificent breakfast area with a wonderful view. There was also a washing machine and dryer, and a very comfortable bathroom. This was a good way to stay in Sydney, especially since we didn't find that many good restaurants, (we used the Chinese takeaway on the same block a lot :-)). There was also a balcony, but it was quite scary to go out on the 19th floor, so we didn't use it. Just a few minuses to prevent us from making it Excellent: In July (winter) it was quite cold inside. There was air conditioning, but it could only make the room cooler. We complained about it, but all they could do was to give us extra blankets. Our daughter ended up with a cold, and kept coughing for weeks afterwards. Although most of the staff were very helpful, some of them weren't, and kept sighing when we asked questions. The elevators are VERY slow. There were only two elevators for 29 (I think) floors, and they kept you waiting forever. Otherwise, I would really recommend this place for a Sydney vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great 2-bedroom aptmt”
Reviews.Author: irishnz
Reviews.Content: 6 of my family members stayed here in Feb 06. Although I live in New Zealand, we took relatives from Northern Ireland over to Sydney for 5 days. My parents and 2 others had a 2-bedroom suite on the 27th floor. As soon as we walked in everyone could not believe the amazing view. There were floor to ceiling windows at the corner of the room allowing you to see over Sydney, down to the Opera House. All the decor and furnishings were modern and the bathrooms were spotless. The lounge area was large and dining area more than adequate. Good facilities in the kitchen and one bathroom also had laundry area. Myself and partner stayed in a studio apartment and this was nice and modern, but nowhere near as impressive as the other room. Bathroom was a decent size and room had a very small balcony. The apartments are close to Town Hall railway station (ensure you come out at the correct exit!) and short walk to shops (Pitt St Mall). It is also convenient to Darling Harbour (about 10 min walk). Excellent location overall. You can either take railway to the Opera House/ Harbour (3 stops) or it is about 20-30 minute walk. I would recommend Medina Aptmts and thought it was real value for money. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ClaireMoxen
Reviews.Content: Executive apartments in perfect location in Darling Harbour. Fully serviced apartments with room service. We didn't use the kitchen at all, but far better than a hotel. One bedroom en-suite and the other bedroom next door to large bathroom. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “just alright”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a premier studio room for a week, studio room was alright for the price, but if you can definitely stay in a 1 bedroom apartment. We tried to upgrade after not really being happy with the room, but they had no apartments left. My biggest complaint would be the noise. Even though we were on the 26th floor, the road noise and noise from nearby buildings air conditioning units was really bad, even with the doors all closed. The other complaint I had was only 1 lift was working the majority of the time, making for long waits for the lift. We stayed here for our honeymoon, which I would not recommend doing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Steve278
Reviews.Content: Excellent location,rooms were large and well set out. We stayed there with family who were all on seperate floors, we had alot of trouble with the elevators from floor to floor, staff should have explained the security set up to us. One day there was only one elevator working and we waited for 30min as we were on top floor,this can happen anywhere but it took all day to fix. Staff were extremely unhelpful,would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “is it really that bad?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel in September 2003 and I was quite happy with it as it is so close to Town Hall. It is a definite prime location! The room was quite clean; the pool and sauna was ok! To be honest, you could never compare the hotels in Australia with those in overseas. Like, you should never expect a hotel as lavish (and cheap!) in Sydney compared with those in Bangkok.

Reviews.Title: “great apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbGal1972
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in a few medinas as they often have apartments instead of just rooms. Stayed in a 1 bed room and it was huge and well set up - separate kitchen and bathroom. Even a stereo which you often don't get. Good location - an easy walk to darling harbour and QVB shops and right near Town Hall train station - so easy access to the airport if you're on a budget. I've stayed in about 10-12 sydney hotels over the past year and this one is worth it, esp if you want a bit more room.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5 Star in my book”
Reviews.Author: SandBlastedKid32
Reviews.Content: I have been to many hotels being because I travel for work and this hotel was a disappointment. First, I get to the hotel and I hear a two woman complaining at the reception that it was cold in their room and the thermastat was broken. I go to my room and mine was not working as well. They told me the heat cannot be turned on, only cold air. It maybe warm during the day to have the cold air, but at night it would be nice to have heat. I walked in my room and it looked a little dirty. The carpet had stains. Everything looked like it hasn't been cleaned in quite awhile. The one thing I really don't like is there is no lock on the front door. Anyone can walk in who has a key, so its very important you put the "Do not Disturb" sign on your door. I landed here in the morning and wanted to order lunch "Room Service", no room service until 6pm and they offer a menu service where different restaurants deliver to the hotel. They offer lunch, but you must order 24hours ahead in order to get it. The walls are very thin. I hear the door slamming. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: oceansd
Reviews.Content: On checking in we (7people)were offered a double room (for 4 people) (which we accepted without looking)+ the triple room that was already booked. However the room was not quite ready so we went away. On our return we were told that we could have the room for 4 people plus 1 room for 2 people plus a fold out. We told them this was unacceptable and to cut a very long story short we ended up okay in the room situation. However, we overheard them talking about us and complaining about certain members of our party. On one of the days two of our people were being picked up by a relative that had travelled 2 hours and when the person called for them at 8am they were told that there was nobody there by that name so this person went away for 1 1/2 hours and luckily came back just as the 2 people were outside looking for them. The shower did not work properly and I did mention about it- they said they would have it looked at, but it did not improve in the 5 days that we were there. The dishwasher did not work and the dishes in the cupboard on our arrival were very dirty. I think this hotel needs to do some serious work in the management area and PR area. No I would never stay there again and will not be recommending to my fellow colleagues. Was totally dissapointed and will advise my travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, staff unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: atcer28
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights June 2003. I was originally given a 1 bedroom apartment instead of the studio I booked but the apartment had a handicppaed bathroom with no bath so I changed back to the original studio. This was very small with just a bed, desk with chair and tiny kitchen area. The 1 bedroom apartment was huge and nicely furnished with washing machine and tumble dryer as well as a big kitchen with all equipment. The problem I had was that I stayed in June and the hotel had switched the heating on despite the weather being 20C. The air conditoning was switched off so you could not control the temperature of the rooms. My room was around 32C and the only way to cool it was to open the balcony door and then you couldn't sleep because of the noise!! When I complained to reception I was told basically that the heating was on so it was tough!! Not the best attitude! I would recommend this hotel in the summer when you can use the air conditioning but only the 1 bed apartment. A normal hotel room is much bigger than the studio for the same money. The location was excellent as you could walk to darling harbour, QVB and town hall train station in a couple of minutes. The restaurant delivery service was also a good idea but the brochure supplied was out of date as many restaurants in it were no longer part of the scheme.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff, especially the bellboy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK...our room was rather small and the furniture were falling apart so I guess the rate wasn't really worth it. Although I'd have to say the staff were very lovely, especially one bellboy who made us all very welcome and at ease. The pool was small but elegant and I really admired the staffs attitude towards us.

HotelInfo.Name: Medina Grand Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 511 Kent & Bathurst Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
